description:
SF Raavi is VERY nice.

It's self serve which is nice for those who dont like the idea of paying after eating and predetermined tipping. They offer chai tea and restroom usage after a meal purchase.

Raavi has a lunch deal on the weekdays that offers the curry of the day, lentils, half a flat bread(Nann), salad and rice... This isn't really that filling. I would order one the kebabs, and plain rice to get filled up. 

If you're not eating by yourself, just add a curry for each additional person. I usually order a Chicken Tikka Kebab, Chicken Daal(Lentil), or any of the vindaloos(spicy oil). Potato(Alu) flat bread is the most filling choice to accompany curry and rice always filled bellies. 

If you're a masochist that just like suffering from scoville burns, make sure to say "very spicy please"(add another very for an additional level) when ordering.

I usually get food to go but when I do eat there, it *feels* like India(like, they played Tunak Tunak Tun-type songs).

I've been coming here for more than two years and they've been pestering me for a review on yelp so here it is. Once again, VERY NICE.
author: Jay W.

description:
Fish masala - 4.5/5. Good flavors well cooked tasted great 
Pulao (flavored rice) -4.5/5 good quantity great taste
Chicken breast - 4/5 flavoring was good but could have left it to roast in the tandoor a bit longer to give it an extra crisp
Tea -2.5/5. Flavoring was good but it came out like warm from the canister so didn't taste good. Indian tea has to be hot not warm

Overall 4/5
Will definitely come back and try other dishes
author: Vikas J.

description:
I was feeling pretty hungry one evening and I stopped by here since it was also pretty cold outside, and I was feeling something spicy to warm me up. Raavi is one of the few Indian places within the area and I haven't had biryani for a long time, so I was tempted to go for that. I looked through the biryanis, and decided to get the lamb biryani, although I was also drawn to the vegetable biryani as well.

This place is pretty close to a self-serve establishment, and you're expected to get your own utensils and water in the back. A couple minutes after I ordered, my lamb biryani came, and I dug in. The lamb biryani was pretty wet, and the spices were overpowering in a good way. I took my time, savoring every bite, taking in the spices. At the end, I was feeling pretty full, and very satiated.

Raavi left a very positive impression on me, and I would definitely come back here again to sample the other biryani dishes. Definitely the veggie biryani for sure, and then some. Solid four star place and highly recommended to others who are craving Indian.
author: Nelson X.

description:
Checked on Postmates and this was one of the few Indian restaurants that were open before 12pm. 

We ordered the following:

Garbanzo beans - good texture, but a little bland.
Paneer in butter sauce - was a little too sweet.
Spinach and potatoes - This was awesome.  Would get again.
Dal - Pretty good. 

Rice - on the dry side.
Naan - was mushy by the time we got it. 

Overall, was still a decent meal for a delivery meal.  My Indian bosses liked it so we'd likely order from them again.
author: Vi Y.

description:
Raavi - What a cool little spot. It get packed during lunch I went with the Lamb Korma.   What was neat for a sports fan like me was that they had several tv's on the world cup. 

The lamb korma was very thick and there was a generous amount of actual Lamb in the dish. The fresh naan was also good and went well with the sauce.
author: Rod M.

description:
Ordered food via Yelp thru GrubHub without a hitch.  Food came faster than expected.  The Lamb and chickpeas was very tender, flavor was good, but not earth shattering.  The roti was ok, but a little burnt, but that's ok, I like burnt stuff so no problem there. Rice was as expected. 

Samosa was 4 pieces which I did not expect  that was a nice surprise.  So you get 4 samosa for the price listed which the Yelp menu does not explain.  You also get 2 sauces , one was a savory onion/coriander and the other was a sweet berry of some kind I coudlnt identify. The samosa was Spicer than I like, but not flavorful,  if you know what I mean, so I wasn't loving that. I love a flavorful samosa with freshly roasted and ground spices, not just heat for the sake of heat.  But that's just me.  I was wishing I had ordered a lassi because it was so hot.  But all in all it was good.  I would recommend.
author: Joy G.

description:
I got the lamb korma with rice, as well as the butter chicken with naan. Overall, a solid, no-frills sort of spot.

The lamb korma was a thinner sort of curry, with very solid pieces of lamb if that's your thing (I'm into more of the chewy lamb / goat, but that's just preference). Not quite as spiced as some other spots. The rice portion was pretty generous.

The butter chicken was tender and creamy. The naan (carbs come separate) was pretty fresh, though a bit oily.

Their mango lassi was pretty standard, and they also have free chai. I saw their rose lassi after I ordered-- gonna check that out next time!

--

Edit: I came back for the fish curry and potato naan. There was a decent amount of fish in the curry, and it had been left intact so you could cut it up into pieces, or keep it whole depending on what you prefer. The consistency was a thinner sort of curry, like the lamb korma I had. Heat-wise, it didn't feel super spicy upon first bite, but left your mouth hot during the meal. 

The potato naan was a bit thin on the potato filling, but overall large portion size. Also pretty spicy on the potato naan!
author: Nicole H.

description:
The best Indian food I've ever had in the Bay Area, if not the best EVER! They have the flavor and spices absolutely correct for optimum yum factor in this hole in the wall. Just step inside and smell the aroma for yourself, you can tell immediately you've come to the right place. The portion sizes are small but with so much flavor it packs a big punch and will fill you up quickly. I highly recommend going family style and trying a big variety. The prices are average so if you want Indian food, it's best to go here! Here are the dishes I loved:

Butter Chicken Curry - every other Indian place should just go home. This was the best version of this dish I've ever had. 

Aloo Gobhi - classic flavors and slightly undercooked veggies which is how I like it so it's less mushy

Palak Paneer - first time trying this and the paneer is amazing

They also store well, I've been eating leftovers all week!
author: Tu-Quyen P.

description:
Found this place pretty close to our hotel so decided to give it a try!

We ordered Rose Lassi and Mango lassi as drinks. For dishes, we ordered tandoori prawn, lamb vindaloo, and butter chicken. We also ordered two pieces of garlic naan. All of this was ordered togo so that we could go watch the Oscars tonight from our hotel room!

The Rose Lassi tastes good but I guess I don't like the rose water/taste? It doesn't taste like anything to me haha. My SO enjoyed his mango lassi. We didn't share since he's sick but I assume it's delicious.

The butter chicken tasted decent. The flavor is definitely there. I can't quite point it out but it is different from other butter chicken that I've had. Maybe more paste-y than I'm used to.

The lamb vindaloo is fabulous. Definitely delicious and also has heat to it.

My favorite is the tandoori shrimp. Although a bit expensive ($10 for 6 pieces of shrimp), the flavor is fabulous!

The atmosphere is casual and pay and order/self service.
author: Cindy N.

description: I have never been to the actual restaurant but I swear their staff see my mine pretty often on their "to go" orders haha :) Its the best chicken tikka masala in the city, in my humble opinion... just the right amount of spices, and juicy chicken! I mix that to the rice and leave some of the curry to dip my garlic naan on it - perfect lunch! I love it!!!
author: Daffny V.

description: Walked in for an early lunch. The samosas and the butter paneer dishes were super tasty, felt authentic. The whole place is self serve - given the main course dish prices are a good 3/4 dollars less compared to other places, I don't mind it at all. The chai wasn't that great, perhaps that particular batch didn't live up to the standards of other dishes. If you want chutneys, they have them stored in the fridge, all you have to do is go get it & serve yourself. Deliciousness will follow. It's a low key very causal place. This place doesn't try to be more than the food. Definitely going back!
author: Akhil K.

description: I passed by this restaurant so many times and finally managed to try it. This is very authentic Indian food, and I very much enjoyed the experience. I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer, my absolute two favorite. The chicken Tikka Masala was full with flavors with fresh tomato puree, cilantro, and so many spices. The Palak Paneer also was full of flavors with fresh spinach puree and excellent texture of the paneer. The staff was very friendly and kind. This place seems to be family run place. My cashier and the manager seems to be brothers. I would come here again :)
author: Lisa O.

description:
Best Biriyani
fast customer service 
Humorous, friendly and humble owner everyone have to meet and taste foodseved from him and prepared inside  his kitchen
author: Mangal T.

description: We were looking for affordable vegan options and found this delicious restaurant. We weren't so sure walking in, but I looked at my husband and said, who knows! It could be amazingly good. And of course I was right!! Great options, great price, I definitely recommend!
author: Dulcinea R.

description: Woah... That was the word that came out of my mouth when i took the first bite of chicken tikka masala. The food is really authentic and the dishes i tried(chickem tikka masala, paneer tikka masala, shahi chiken and kheer) were upto the mark. Would definitely recommend the tikka masala.
author: Sharad B.

description:
For our office lunch on Friday, August 25th, I decided I wanted Indian food. Good thing too as I was a little delicate from the night before. (I always crave Indian after a night of drinking. There's something comforting about curry the next day.) Our delivery order arrived via Caviar a little past 11:30am.

*Samosa: Two pieces, Deep fried pastry shells, stuffed with potatoes and peas ($4)
*Tikka Masala: Chicken cooked in a tomato based curry ($9)
*Stuffed Naan ($2 each): Onion Naan, Garlic Naan (+$0.50)

At work, we have a $20 limit for lunch. Price wise, Raavi was great as I was able to place my usual delivery order. (It's over $20 most of the time.) I noted the curry should be extra spicy and they listened. It had a nice heat. Both naan were soft with a nice chew. Though I did think both could have used more garlic and onion. The samosas were crispy and the filling soft. I did wish the mint chutney was more flavorful to add a contrast. It wasn't very minty. Also, there wasn't much of it.

Definitely a comforting meal. And all for $17.50. Not bad considering I had an appetizer, curry, and two naan. I'd be happy if Raavi popped up again as an option at work. Especially after a night of drinking. Gimme that tikka masala!
author: Elena N.

description:
Very impressed with this place and very happy it opened up in the mid-market area.

Tried this place for the first time thanks to MealPal, but their normal four-item lunch special for $8.99 is a deal unto itself and ready to go if you need take out.

The chicken tikka is delicious. Very north-indian (if you like North India or Pakwan you'll like this place too). And the Lamb Curry is one of the better lamb curries I've tried (much better quality meat too).

I am absolutely going back but likely not with MealPal as the four-time for $8.99 would be amazing.

Also, if it's cold or raining, the hot chai is top notch, just fyi.
author: Mike V.

description:
Raavis is an excellent indian restaurant for the price.  They do the classics like chicken tikka massala and plain naan well and the check is generally going to be below $15.

The food is good and cheap but the restaurant could use a bit of a renovation.  The restaurant is located in a weird triangle on the intersection of a couple of major streets so it can be hard to find if you don't know your way.  I wish they had better chai.
author: Mark C.

description: This is probably going to become my new go-to indian delivery place. We ordered rice, garlic naan, chicken tikka masala and palak paneer. On the good side, everything was delicious - I loved the flavoring and consistencies of our curries. On the down side, the delivery took close to two hours, and when we called the restaurant back for a status, she was pretty much dismissive of the issue and her main objective was to get off the phone with us. So, customer service-wise, awful. But taste-wise, great!
author: Melissa T.

description: Great flavors at a reasonable price. Lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka, and garlic naan. You have to get your own plate, utensils, and water from a station, but who cares when it tastes this good.
author: David F.

description:
I ate here with a group and maybe we over ordered and now I need to lay down. 

It's simple. Total hole in the wall. It was smoky due to the tandoori. And we were so there for it! We ordered a bunch of meat things (Not for me), plus paratha, naan (the garlic naan was life changing), chana masala, saag paneer, okra, cauliflower. God, it was good. Not too spicy, for the sensitive people. Great flavor. More saucy than a lot of North Indian food, but so damn good. I would come back for it!
author: Laura C.

description: Great  Indian food that's reliable and quick! Awesome food for the price.  One of the least expensive Indian Restaurants with good quality.  I love the tikka masala and they use white meat.  Their naan is great -- try the stuffed meat naan with sauce!
author: Fawn M.

description:
A solid 3-star.  Food is 2.5.  Friendly fast service.  Overall it's a meh to me.  With so many (cheaper) options close by, not sure if i'll come back.

Heard great reviews by friends who came for lunch so decided to try it for dinner.  A bit pricey for the quality.  Everything is good, not great, and some dishes are a bit too salty.  For similar pricing, Shalimar is much much better. 

Some of the ingredients are not the freshest... and easily disguised by the curry and spices.  

For example, We had a party of 3 and ordered the following;
- Chicken Tikka Masala.  just ok.  not too flavorful and chicken pieces were not tender as I had hoped.  Usage of spices were ok.  There were flavors but mainly tasted salty and lacked the fragrant of the masala sauce.  Typically this is my favorite dish so i was a bit disappointed.
-  Lamb Saag.  The lamb saag were too salty, but not unbearable heart attack salty so we stuck with the dish.  Lamb pieces were either over cooked and dry or just old and reheated; again - chewy.
- Okra Curry -  okras were old and stringy.  We couldn't chew it through.  I wouldn't recommend this dish.
- Tandoor chicken leg.  This is a typical dish to me and a safe dish.  This one does not disappoint and turns out to be the best dish of the evening.  
- Basmati rice plain.  Just ok.  How can rice be ok you may ask?  Well, the rice is dry and just dry to the bone.  Which could indicate its old.  Fresh quality basmati rice has a dry texture and a slight chew and fragrant to it.  Their rice lacks the fragrant of a freshly cooked rice nor the slight moisture in rice pieces.  This indicates =
old, reheated rice.  
- Mango Lassi.  At $3.50 a pop, this is ok.  A tad too sweet for my taste but i'm sure it's fine for others.  Flavorful mango lassi.  


Food is 2-3 stars.  Service is quick and friendly.  Overall 3 stars for me.
author: Winnie W.

description:
Ordered on Eat 24 and they delivered the wrong food. When I called them, they said they couldn't deliver the food I had ordered. 

I asked why they didn't call me about the issue before delivering the wrong food. I then got into a 20 minute debate on the phone with him. I explained I was allergic to the food they delivered and I had to throw it away. He would not send me the correct food order. And would offer no apology or option. 

We had to re-order and pay again.

When we did get some food we could eat it was ok. Nothing amazing. Not worth the price. The medium spice level was bland.
author: Stacey R.

description:
My friend and I decided to eat at Raavi since we are big fans of Indian food. We typically prefer Indian buffets but Raavi did not have that option. When we first walked into this self service restaurant, we noticed that the room was a bit stuffy. At first, I found that it was a little hard to breathe, although I eventually got used to it. This place did look like a hole in the wall. The lighting was a little dim. Not all of the lights were turned on. In terms of cleanliness, the place was not too clean or dirty. 

We ended up splitting the Butter Chicken ($10.50), Aloo Palak ($8), and two sides of Plain Basmati Rice ($2 each). The portion sizes were decent for its price. In fact, we could barely finish the whole thing! However, both meals tasted a little artificial. 

Butter Chicken: I have bought canned Butter Chicken (Maya Kaimal Indian Simmer Sauce, Butter Masala) from the grocery store. I found that the restaurant sauce reminded me of this canned sauce in terms of taste. It was not very moist. 

Aloo Palak: This dish was super hot (temperature wise)! The spinach part of the dish tasted differently from what I imagined. It was thicker than I expected. The sauce was not very liquidy. I did like the potatoes though! They were not too soft. 

Plain Basmati: The rice was a little bit dry, but we got huge portions! 

It was nice to see the pictures of some of the meals on the wall. The Butter Chicken that we ordered looked different from the image on the wall; our dish was much lighter and looked nicer, :p. 

The employees placed the food on the table, but we were expected to pick up our own utensils. There were water cups near the side of the cashier register. At first, I thought that there was no ice since I just saw a large container of water. When I poured water into the cup, I was surprised to find the water to be cold!

The place smelled strong and our clothes smelled like Indian food after we left. This seems to be typical of Indian restaurants anyways.

In general, the food tasted average. I'm not sure if I will be coming back.
author: Kristina M.

description:
After a truly disappointing (and quite frankly 'hellish' experience at Nanking) lunch, we just wanted to get some relief, a sense of fulfillment. So, while casually strolling around, we stumbled upon this gem of a place.

Delicious Chai, Gulab Jamun and Samosas. Now you may think how can I assign 4 stars based on that? Well, well. We aren't that stupid are we.

Got a Goat Biryani for takeout which was fantabulous! Rice was cooked to perfection with mouthwatering spices and tender meat.

If I find myself in the area again, I'll surely drop by again, after skipping a meal.
author: Shantanu B.

description:
Was craving naan and since work is so close, I decided to give this place a try. I was planning on ordering on Yelp. When I was about to check out, I noticed they charged a bag fee. The garlic naan was $2.50, and it totaled to $2.83. I was expecting this same price if I ordered in the store. Decided not to order online and just do a phone order. When I went to pick up, the total was $3.58. 

I'm not sure why there is a difference in charge for ordering through Yelp vs. doing a phone order. This difference is pretty big. I would come back to try their lunch special eventually. But for now, I was unimpressed by this service. 

Okay, the garlic naan. The flavor was very good. However, the naan was very flat and tough to get through. Ive had naan that's super soft and puffy, but this one wasn't one of them.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Best Chai.
Okay Vegetable Biryani.
Bad Gobi Ghost.

Goat pieces were not properly marinated, just added to some tomato based curry base. Do not order any Goat curry here without asking if Goat was marinated properly..if not do not order goat based curry at this place ever!
author: A M.

description: Had Chicken tikka masala and naan. Good food. They have chai on the house (chai was good too). Place does get busy around lunch hours. They have special lunch Thalis (combos) as well. Overall a good place.
author: Ankit K.

description:
3.5 stars.
While the food was ok it took them forever to prepare it. About 25-30 mins during lunch. Don't come if you have no patience.
This place does not have table service. Order at the counter and wait for your food.
Do not use the bathroom if you don't have to. The bathroom is down a dark stair case and the toilet paper on the roll was previously wet and put back up for use ewwww.
author: Liz N.

description: Wow, chicken vindaloo was amazingly good..samosas where perfect. Naan, was naan. Get past the look of this place and try it out. Warring it's on the true spicy side if you don't like spicy, ask for the less spicy options.
author: Guillermo P.

description: Everything is just Ok. We ve ordered from here quite a few times as it's close to our place but they are consistently Mediocre when it comes to indian food. Although that still means they are better than most other SF indian restaurants.
author: Rahul K.

description: Don't eat in this restaurant!!! I m writing this review and I'm sick after I ordered from them butter chicken and naan bread i got a food poisoning now it's been a week and I'm still sick please don't eat there it's horrible !!!!
author: Jiiji S.

description:
We were staying at the Hilton in Chinatown, and were looking for restaurants who would deliver to our hotel. This restaurant does, and we decided to order. So my review is based on the food only, not on service/ambiance etc.

We ordered the following:
- Veggie Biryani: This was very good and the portion was very generous.
- Aaloo (Potato) Paratha: This is very dry and tasteless. Aaloo parathas are supposed to be soft and flavorful, but this one was very hard. Maybe its nice and soft at the restaurant, but takeout was bad.

My husband ordered a chicken dish and absolutely loved it.

Would definitely like to try other dishes on their menu next time I am in SF.
author: Ani J.

description:
Self Service Indian Restaurant. 
You place and pay your order at the register then served yourself with their delicious complimentary hot milk tea. 
Great customer service and reasonably price meal.
author: Kath S.

description: Best Palak Paneer I EVER had. Seriously. I love this place. It's a block from my office YAY!
author: Kiley G.

description: Placed an order on Postmates for Kadhai paneer and aloo vindaloo. The food didn't taste authentic or good.
author: Ramya T.

description:
I'm sad to write this because I've been getting takeout from here for a while and really like it. I usually get the vegetable biryani, and the portions are great.

The issue is that, today when I was eating the biryani, I bit something that felt like a staple. To my horror, it was a thin, curled metal wire. This made me extremely apprehensive when eating the rest of the rice. I'm getting queasy imagining what would've happened if I hadn't detected the wire while chewing.

I like Raavi a lot, but thought I should let others know what happened, particularly because I saw another Yelp review for this place where the reviewer found a staple in their chicken tikka masala.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Quick service. Chicken masala with the basmati rice and garlic naan is the way to go. Not expensive totally worth the price. I've had better Indian food, but they are quick with carry out orders. The restaurant looks like some cafeteria with very old furniture, and gets really busy during lunch and early dinner hours
author: Jelly J.

description:
We love Raavi! If you're looking for some of the best Indian food in the city you need to try this place. My fiancé and I come here almost every week. 

Definitely try the garlic naan (one is enough for two people) and the classics but don't be afraid to venture off and get something you've never had before. Everything I've had here is amazing. 

The staff are also really nice people which is a major plus in my book.

This is a super casual place with great prices. Dishes cost around $10. We usually get two dishes, naan, and a side of rice (under $30) and are totally stuffed by the end of the meal.
author: Bodhi L.

description:
Sigh! I'd bookmarked this place going by the reviews. 
But while food tastes good while having.. It ended up in terrible food poisoning.. 
I hope the health department looks into the hygiene & quality of food served here..
author: Vinod F.

description:
The worst biryani I ate in my life ! Too much rice (about 300 g. and it was not basmati but a "basic") and nothing else. I just want to precise that it's a dish for feast. I had say to them they are not correct but I have thought they are pork !!! I take byriani with prawns: there were 6 shrimps, some green peas and, too much curry sauce. 
The cheese naan is baked with too much garlic.
I take away, cooked all again with fresh carrots, tomatoes, onions and eggs and rice for reduced the too much sauce they cooked. I have a byriani now for 3 meals!!!!
It's a scandalous to come for having a feast lunch and exit restaurant for cooking again. But you know what : I had in my fridge (cooking myself) and freeze a curry meal with potatoes, carrots and sweet potatoes, chicken ; when I came back from the disaster lunch, I took one bag of my curry cooked and ate it for being less angry. I can't say anything else but there are not fair. If you want to be abused for paying bad food, go ahead there !!! For me, wasting time and money!!!! Just one thing is good, it's the mango lassi but after what I said it is perhaps an industrial product!
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Ordered:Lamb korma and chicken tika masala with garlic naan. 

Both were good but the lamb korma had me wishing I could take 3 more orders home to eat for meals the next day. Garlic naan was a wonderful texture and oh soooo fresh! 

Bonus: free yummy chai on tap to help yourself to while you wait! Food was fast and hot! Prices are suuuuper reasonable. 

We will definitely be back! Such an amazing hold in the wall
author: Blyss L.

description: Best indian in the city and possible the best iv had in general. Super flavorful and large portions most of which are under 10 bucks. I had my go to paneer tikka masala with both basmati rice and fresh naan and they certainly delivered. I plan on coming back with my vegan coworker since they offer huge vegie based combo platters with rice, curry, naan, salad, etc for 7 bucks in a hip atmosphere.
author: Sean G.

description: This place raised my bar for what good Indian food is. I got the butter chicken with rice and garlic naan. It was a bit pricy for a lunch (~$16), but  well worth the price and the walk over from SoMa. The garlic naan was seasoned well, and butter chicken very tasty. I'll certainly be back some day.
author: Matthew P.

description: My initial reaction was that this was a messy restaurant that I did not want to eat at. Unfortunately I had just walked in when 8 diners had left and the staffing is so minimal, it was a big messy table in the middle of the tiny eatery. In fact we almost didn't eat there. After a little internet research we learned people really had enjoyed the food. It is simply bare bones self service which allows you a great price. So if you enjoy Indian Food, it's worth your investigation. They don't moderate the heat levels for delicate palates-so if spicy hot isn't something you can manage- grab a side of raita. Great food at a Great price. Try it out.
author: Paul Andrew C.

description:
Food was fresh and flavorful. The service was superb. Fast, reasonably priced and soooo good!! GO TO THERE!! :) 

Cheerio!
author: Denise L.

description:
Very bad food quality 
After having food from here me and my husband had stomach issues.
author: Ritika L.

description: Raavi is a hidden gem. Anything and everything on the menu is filled with flavors and is delicious. Ended up visiting more than thrice within a week. Low price point $ as well
author: Gunvansh K.

description:
While staying in San Francisco, upon arriving at our hotel,we were famished. On the verge of hangry - to be honest. Thanks to Yelp,we found this little Indian restaurant literally around the corner from the hotel! The staff was kind, helpful and informative. We do ask a lot of questions about our food.

 What do they say? It's all about the sauce? Well... All sauces we're out of this world!!! Which was a good thing because we sopped it up with delicious garlic naan. We brought leftovers back to the hotel to share with the kids. If San Francisco wasn't such a foodie city, we would have eaten there again. 

Do not miss this culinary treat when in the financial district! You won't be disappointed!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: 7-9 $ for an Indian full lunch combo in SF downtown . Can't get cheaper than this . Good service too . Additionally the complimentary onions , chillies and the sauces add to the taste . Ample seating area .
author: Sudhanshu M.

description:
Raavi has been my favorite Indian restaurant in SF for quite a while. Not just SF, it's the best Indian restaurant I've been in the US so far. 
Some of the must haves are Kadhai Prawns, Kadhai Paneer, Plain Naan, any of the Biryanis, Lamb and Chicken Seekh Kebabs, and of course, Chaai.
During my time in the city, I visited Raavi about 5 times a week. We wouldn't cook at home and Raavi serving some of the best Indian dishes was one of the reasons. 
If you're a tourist in SF, you absolutely have to eat at Raavi at least once. For locals, I'm pretty sure many have been here and that they all love it.
author: Sahil K.

description: BAD , BAD  FOOD NOW a new lady server so rude and unhelpful---used to be good  food place --now they add water to their  left over food from others  (specially lunch )and serve it to new customers specially for dinner  time ---i used to go there before  (they steal a  restaurant's name in Dubai known for real  good food in Dubai ) now dilute their  food  with water or burned milk and ,""shame """serve them to people for dinner ====got sick few times , it must have a new owner plus  a very rude lady server working there now --such a pity used to be good food in north beach and now it sucks make people sick that is a shame ------Dirty , saw a mouse there in the restroom-----Help your health and pocket do not go there-------We stop eating there
author: Lo W.

description:
Have dined or ordered from here a few times now. 

The dal makhani is truly exceptional! I always miss the real creamy dal makhani (like it's supposed to be) and this place has become a go-to for the same reason. 

Chicken tandoori leg is awesome. Served sizzling in a skillet and is quite a big portion

Chole masala is quite average but still tasty. Not greasy at all.

Garlic naan is awesome and done perfectly! 

Palak paneer is creamy and quite flavorful as well without being too greasy.
author: Mahak R.

description:
A lot of things went wrong when I visited here. 
1) They served the appetizer after main course.
2) They didn't give Raita or chutney with Biriyani and kabab. When I asked for it, they said that I need to go to the counter and pay for it. They didn't put any extra effort to compensate the customer. 

It would have been okay, if the food was good, as I weigh ambience and customer care way below taste for reviewing a restaurant. But, the food was terrible.  I could taste the  uncooked marination flavor in Chicken kabab. Mixing rice, meat and gravy and adding some green peas and coriander leaves to it hardly even qualifies to be even called as a biriyani. It's amateurish.

So sorry to rate it low. But, rating it higher would be a disservice for fellow foodies and I feel it's misleading to have such a high rating for this restaurant in Yelp, which adds to the disappointment.
author: Jim M.

description:
I absolutely love this place!!! I order from Raavi regularly and it consistently delivers the most delicious Indian food out there! It brings me to a happy place every time! Thank you, so much for such delicious food and consistant quality! 
my favorite is Butter chicken and paneer naan :)
author: Santa R.

description:
Excellent service and food. They let us bring our own beers and even gave us a big bucket full of ice for cooling them. 
Best experience ever!
author: Alejo E.

description: The first restaurant I am seeing that doesn't serve a small bowl of taiga when we order their biryani. The biryani also didn't taste good and had only French beans in them. Prices seem inexpensive but the quantity is quite less and curries don't come up with rice. Customer service was very poor and the lady taking the orders was very rude and unfriendly. Won't recommend this place to anyone and won't visit again.
author: Dikshi M.

description: Very nice genuine staff. Great food. Gotta try the lamb vindaloo. I prefer goat other than curry though. Tea, onions, serano pepper, & lemons are free. Tea had a weird taste to it so I'll pass on it next time. Rest are fine. Will be back.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Good quality North Indian food, but definitely do not come here for the atmosphere. The restaurant itself is pretty run down and unclean. Chicken tikka masala was great, the saag paneer not so much. 

Solid spot for a quick bite. Takeout is probably your best bet.
author: Danish M.

description:
Second time I crave Indian cuisine in a week! 

$8 for a lunch special that was delicious and filling too. Plate case in a silver style tray with three bowls and two rectangles.

I had chicken curry, a potato curry in another bowl, and another curry - spice infused side. This third side added some spice and served as a condiment to the white rice. 

Nann bread was great with any three sides you matched it with. Naan bread is just amazing tbh. I can eat this bread 5 ever.

The salad was served in room temperature, I suggest serving it "cool" to kind of balance the food's warmness.

Overall 4 stars for the food, 1 Star missing because it's cash only, wish they accepted card!
author: Bryan B.

description: Great food and great service. I almost forgot an item in my order and the cashier chased me down the street to give it to me. Fantastic service! Cheers guys thanks!
author: Tony N.

description: Been coming here for the past year and always loved it. Went tonight and was disappointed. Flavor is different, more bland. Chicken korma was watery. Used to be so flavorful. Suspect new ownership or management since they have a new sign and remodeled bathrooms. Where to go now???
author: Liz C.

description: Loved the tandoori chicken, best in town. The chicken Tikka masala wasn't as spectacular.
author: Arien H.

description:
OMG Raavi had became my fav Indian restaurant! Amazing food, great price and the people who work there are charming and helpful!
Just what you need after a stressful working day
author: Gabriela L.

description: Excellent Indian restaurant that I go to each time I travel for work in San Francisco. It has consistently provided great tasty food and I can warmly recommend it!
author: Jean B.

description: Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Came out hot and very fast. Also, it was quite cheap!
author: Brandon T.

description:
This place is amazing. 
My girlfriend and I are working our way through every dish on the menu. So far they've all been great.
The Bhaingan Bharta (sorry for the spelling!) is really good, as is the Bhindi Chicken. 
The atmosphere inside is calming and comforting, and the staff are always very friendly. 
The food is served quickly, and is extremely flavorful.
Most importantly, the food is consistently good, no matter what you order. We've never been disappointed.
So all in all this place is a real gem.
author: Micah D.

description: Ordered through Grubhub, excellent food, probably one of the best Indian food in the city. Enjoyed every dish.
author: Vicky S.

description: I love me some Raavi. I always order the chicken tikka masala with naan and rice. This place has THE best Indian food in the Fidi. They also have some great lunch and daily deal specials.
author: Ann E.

description:
Amazing food . Clean and big.
Very well organized. 
Nice music 
Best Indian food in the city
author: Yos R.

description:
Food is okayish here. We tried chicken curry and couple of veg curries with variety of breads. Chicken was pretty hard and curries were pretty bland. Naan were not properly cooked. 

This place is cheap though but food is totally not worth.
author: Ankur G.

description: Tandoori chicken leg was stringy and dry and overdone. Failed attempt at making it moist by smothering it with a mound of sautéed onions.  Breast meat also hard and dry.  Best dish was the raita.  Go to Shalimar for tandoori, moist, succulent, cooked while you wait, the best.
author: blaine s.

description:
Chicken Tikka Masala Heaven!

Definitely a hidden gem! Not only is this place affordable but their Tikka Masala is by far the best I've ever had. It's flavorful and creamy goodness will have you salivating and coming back for more. I definitely ate enough for 2 or 3 people. Also, the garlic naan (packed with flavor) and basmati rice are great additions to the chicken tikka masala (the usual stuff). The chana, paneer, etc. were good but not great. I'd classify the tikka masala recipe as culinary excellence.  

The restaurant is clean and the staff is friendly. This is not a place to go if you're looking for a fancy environment or trying to impress someone but if you want solid food for a reasonable price, then it's definitely worth a trip!
author: Tasha T.

description: This was an amazing place for myself and a large group of friends to eat while visiting San Fran. They were very accommodating of our large group and the food was amazing.
author: Danielle R.

description:
Ordering delivery has been kinda scary lately because I have had bad experiences. 

Not at Raavi! I ordered thru yelp for delivery and they delivered right on time.

Really fresh, delicious shrimp Masala :)

Thanks for rescuing me from Hunger!
author: Cindy S.

description:
I ordered this through Uber Eats since they had a pretty high rating and were close by. I am sad to say I don't think I've ever had worse Indian food. The Garlic Naan looked like it was sprayed with garlic butter rather than made with actual minced garlic. The sauces that came with the vegetable samosas were inedible. The lamb tikka masala didn't come with rice and just didn't have a good flavor. Most tikka masalas come with vegetables or something other than just the sauce and the protein. The lamb itself was actually pretty awful too - tasted more like pork roast. 

Maybe it was an off night for them.
author: Shelby O.

description:
We ordered delivery. Fairly straight forward, no frills order of Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo. We asked for the Masala mild and the Lamb Vindaloo SPICY (as in hot, very nearly authentic spicy).

It arrived in 19 minutes. NINETEEN MINUTES!!!! In a city where delivery usually takes more than an hour, I was delighted... No, delighted doesn't even go nearly far enough... I WAS ECSTATIC!!! BLOWN AWAY! WOWED! 

As soon as the initial excitement wore off, I suddenly felt skeptical- a bit apprehensive if you will. How.... could this food... have arrived in 19 minutes and also been cooked fresh? A shiver of worry ran through me.

Then I poured the rice in the bowl, drowned it with Vindaloo and took my first bite. Mmmmmm instant goodness! First the flavor and then next the sudden rush of heat... My cheeks flushed red and my eyes lightly teared... Yes!! VICTORY! The perfect level of heat. Flavor + Light tears = heaven... Nice and spicy!!

Girlfriend loved the Tikka Masala and it was her perfect level of mild.

Amazingly fast delivery, scrumptious meal = 5 Stars!

THANK YOU RAAVI!!
author: Ryan K.

description: We ordered a few chicken dishes and some sea food and it was very old. The chicken smelled bad and it was over cooked and hard. The dish was supposed to be from the grill and it was sauteed with some spicy sauce to cover up for the old meat. Just get some soda and walk out of this place and you'll save yourself a trip to the ER.
author: Charles B.

description:
Humble owner/staff, quick- delicious- inexpensive food. 
l was hearing about this restaurant from my friends and wanted to give it a try today. l am really amazed how nice people who work there. It is good to see people who genuinely welcome you and smile! It makes you feel good as a customer! 

It is really a hidden GEM in the financial district. If you want to eat well-cooked Indian food, try Raavi. You can have a pretty good lunch/dinner under $10. Their bottomless chai tea is complimentary and you can drink it until you become 60 years old.
author: Arthur W.

description: My second time visiting and I think this place is solid for the price.  Food is a good value for the location and staff is friendly thud far.  Food was fresh and made to order. And I enjoyed watching the Indian musicals on the tv while dining. Patrons seem pretty cool there to, smiling and seemed happy to be there.  Overall good vibes here.
author: Robert C.

description:
I eat Indian food twice a week and this is one of the best places I have ever been!
When ordering to pick up food they are always on time.
author: Kevin T.

description: I tried their fish last night and ended up with painful diarrhea the next morning. Check their health inspection record: they have 6 violations this year. Not coming back again.
author: Carl W.

description:
We ordered the chicken Tikka masala and garlic naan.  I placed the order online through Yelp for pickup,  and was given an estimate of 35-45 minutes. We arrived about 50 minutes after placing the order and I waited in line to speak with the individual at the counter. They were very busy, so I understood when she went to bus a couple tables, and then answered a call before speaking with me, but then she turned to other patrons who had entered the restaurant after I did, and asked to help them.  She helped two motorcycle delivery drivers, and a man waiting in line behind me who was also there to pick up an order.  Then, only after I said "excuse me" and raised my hand a bit, did she even acknowledge my presence. 
I explained I had placed an order online for take out and she just stared at me. The two delivery drivers had told her the same thing, and she had simply asked for the order numbers and then handed them marked bags.  I held up the confirmation email with the order number and she looked at it and then located the ticket. She said she thought we had already picked up the order so they would have to remake it and it would take a few minutes. So I waited another ten minutes.  She did apologize for the wait, but it was still irritating. 
The food itself was okay, but not great.  The masala sauce was a bit lacking, and the garlic naan appeared to be dyed yellow in sections.  Also, they did not include any rice with the order.
author: Salome T.

description: Good Indian food for decent prices! A meal for two (when sharing) was about 15$ and that was enough for us. An entree doesn't come with rice or naan bread immediately though, so you have to buy everything separately which is a bit of a bummer. However, since things are at fair prices it's not that big of a deal! The naan bread was so delicious and fluffy - cooked perfectly. The veggie samosas were delicious as well with two really fantastic chutneys on the side. The Chana Masala was really good too! Service was relatively fast even though it seemed to be a busy time. Would recommend :-)
author: Kailyn E.

description:
I Swear i'm writing a duplicate of my last restaurant's poor experience, using Allset to order.

I ordered through Allset a Lamb Tikki Marsala. Allset has an image of the dish, which shows the Tikki Marsala and rice. 

When I got mine, I was sorely disappointed to see that it does not come with rice, which is an additional $2. not only that, but in the app some dishes and items are $1 more than they are in the restaurant.

WHY would you use an app that 1) charges you more for the same dishes and 2) forces you to tip BEFORE you get serviced?

Not only that, Allset required me to tip upfront, so I overpaid three times for their bait and switch. Once for $1 more for my dish via Allset. Twice with mandatory tip BEFORE sitting down. Thrice for their garbage SF mandate tax.

Unacceptable.
author: Daniel W.

description: Ordered Chicken Tikka & Garlic Naan. I tried a spoonful of the suace first and let me tell YOU. The sauce is very flavorful, well seasoned and taste so so good!!! The chicken was moist and the medium level of spiciness was just right! The staff was friendly and it was a quick in and out with the food! 1 star less because they couldn't take a phone payment right away! Otherwise a ok in my book.
author: Kam H.

description:
Delicious food! Ordered chicken tikka masala and chicken korma. Soooo good! You can choose your spiciness level. My boyfriend said it might be the best Indian food he has had in SF, and he has tried a lot! 

Very friendly staff, and there's a cute little corner to get your drinks, plates, sauces, etc.  

The place is not the prettiest, but come for the food!
author: Rae C.

description:
Tasty, until I spent the night throwing up and pooping my brains out. The rest of the group only got an upset stomach, or nothing at all. So maybe it was a fluke. This place was so good that I honestly am going to get it again, because I really did like it. 
We got the Tikka Masala and Korma (chicken for both), and holy moly they were amazing! Their naan was amazing, too. 
This food was definitely authentic, which is always nice to see because it's hard to find a truly authentic place since my time in India. The staff was a little standoffish, but it's not really a place where they provide everything for you. Aside from bringing food out, the rest is self serve. 
Anyway, do yourself a favor and try this place! I'm going back for sure and I'll update my review them!
author: Denae L.

description: I go here once or twice a week and can get dinner (two entrees, rice and naan) for 2 for under $25. Pick up is super quick and the food is delicious.
author: Becca W.

description: Excellent food, I like lamb biryani its very testy... N the guys are helpful. You guys deserved completely 5 stars Thanks!!!
author: Yub Raj B.

description: Fantastic chicken biryani! Super polite people!
author: Zachary A.

description:
Fantastic food at fantastic prices. Who can say that about the rest of California let alone SF?

Their lunch combo is $7. And makes your heart flutter with excitement as you find out which of the rotating curries you are going to get that day. Go!
author: the u.

description:
I had the Rice/Biryani Garden fresh vegetables cooked with basmati rice in slow fire and serve hot and the Naan stuffed with Ground Beef.  Very good and not too spicy, big portions.  Well worth the money spent. They have complementary tea. The waitstaff was nice for this cozy place & looking forward to trying out the other items on the menu.

9/13/2017 Update
Had the Chicken Saag and the Garlic Naan.  It was served quickly, piping hot and the waiter provided a plate for me, as there is an area for utensils, napkins, glasses, & cups.  Free tea is offered and it's very good.  The healthy sized portioned meal was excellent and told the same waiter such, along with the maitre d. The whole time I was eating it, I'm telling myself "Wow, this is so good."  This is becoming a favorite stop for me.

11/11/2017 Update
Had the Mixed Vegetable Tikka Masala the Garlic Naan & the Gulab Jamun. The Gulab was good, albeit only 2 milk balls were served.  Otherwise, I really enjoyed this meal and have grown to really like this place.

3/3/2018 Update
I had the Cholay Chicken and Aloo paratha, along with the tea.  The chicken was tender, spices were perfect, and took half of the Aloo paratha home with me b/c I couldn't finish this excellent meal.  The portion was big and I was really hungry.  I told the staff how much I liked it.  This place is a gem.

7/28/2018 Update
Had the Lamb Saag and Plain Naan, along with the tea.  Just outstanding. I relayed that to the staff and that I would "Love them on Yelp." So many options here. Can't wait to go back.

10/2018  Update
Had the Shrimp Saag and the Garlic Naan. Again, just excellent and maybe one of the best values in North Beach.  I can always count on this place.
author: Jim I.

description: I got the palak paneer and a plain naan. The food felt like it had a very homemade taste which was great. The price was also reasonable. I wouldn't say it was the most amazing food I ever had nor was it bad or just average, rather it was slightly positive. I would recommend if you're looking for some decent food to eat without breaking the bank. I will likely be back to try some of the other items on the menu.
author: Karishma M.

description:
We came here for lunch 
we had to wait for a long time
 this restaurant workerneed to stop chit chatting 
they need to respect the lunch time of  customers
author: GQ G.

description: Tasty and inexpensive Indian food, right by the Hilton where we stayed. Good prices and good food, may eat there again if I'm back in the area.
author: Peter S.

description:
Self-serve authentic Indian food around the corner from the Hilton on Kearny.  Food is solid, tastes home-cooked, and cheap!  I'm a fan of really spicy food (taste buds don't work kind of spicy). Too often I go to places and order spicy, and instead of spicy, I get something mild and really oily.  Not here.  Ordered extra spicy with very little oil and got exactly what I asked for.  Achaar fish was very flavorful and it wasn't sitting in oil.  

Ambience isn't the best though.  Not a date place or a place to go for a fun night out, but perfect for me: a table of one when traveling for work.
author: John L.

description:
Ordered for pickup, since last time we ate in, the food was amazing! 
And it was really good this time too, except for the STAPLE I FOUND INSIDE MY TIKKA MASALA.

Thanks god I did not choke on it, otherwise, you guys would get into trouble.

Please make sure you watch your ingredients. 

Not going to this place ever again.
author: Zhamal Z.

description: If you don't love curry but still want to try Indian food, Raavi is the place to go. Chicken breast tandoori appetizer is enough meat for one dinner. The mutter pualoco (yellow rice) is soo soft. Always get naan. This place is cheap too. Try it
author: Kevin J.

description:
Cozy little restaurant. No frills but excellent and authentic Indian food! I travel all over the world and can honestly say this place is on point! Prices are excellent as well and portions are great. Really enjoyed.
I will definitely be returning
author: Yvette K.

description: This place was amazing. 4 stars, only because the atmosphere was not ideal, but after eating the food, I honestly didn't really care. I've eaten a lot of Indian food, and this was authentic, delicious, and fairly priced. Will definitely be back!
author: Kendall M.

description: I go there almost every week. The food is tasty and very cheap. The stuff members are always kind and friendly. I love this place! you much visit.
author: 雅人 Masato

description: Very small portion in the lunch special.   I left very hungry.    The little food I had tasted good though.
author: Dave R.

description:
This review is for chicken Briyani or I should call it peas rice with chicken and tamarind? The worst briyani I ever had.
There is no briyani flavor; it taste and also look like peas rice mixed with left over chicken gravy. Plus you are charging solid 10 bucks for this flavorless rice. The rice is also not basmati rice or it is not cooked well.

Come on guys, if you cannot make briyani then just call it out and move on with just the curry and naan. 

I never recommend this place to anyone .Shame that I cannot give zero or minus star.
author: Rudhra S.

description: They have the best Lamb Korma. I love Indian food and have tried many restaurantes and this place makes the best Korma around. I always do take out but the restaurant is always busy and the other plates look amazing. They have good lunch specials but I can't help but to get the lamb korma every time. It's very rich and filling. I don't care for rice so just get a piece of naan for dunking in the sauce. Heaven! Service is great too, they are very nice and polite which is so unexpected in SF where people in the service industry act like they are doing you a favor.
author: Raquel G.

description:
Fantastic hidden gem!!! This place has actually been here for 13 years, but they don't have much of an online presence so know one knows about it! 

Their specialty is New Delhi Indian food. 

I had the Butter Chicken and tried the Baignan Bharta (eggplant). Both were really good!! Staff was super friendly. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Ryan Y.

description:
Great food, would definitely return if visiting again
Staff is lit too, they are accomodating and more than helpful
author: Soumyadeep C.

description:
Raavi is my go to inexpensive Indian restaurant in North beach. You don't come here for the ambience, what you have is affordable & delicious food. I recommend the Lamb Korma and the Chicken Tikka Masala. The Naan, unlike most places at this price level is fresh with a light coating of butter. (so good)

Of the Indian places at this price level in the city, Raavi is the best I have tried.
author: Raemond B.

description:
a friendly, convenient, and pretty good.

located in the heart of North Beach between Chinatown, Financial district and Little Italy, this Indian Restaurant is where I usually go to if I'm in the mood for some spicy biryani.
I ordered a vegetable biryani and a chicken biryani and they gave me two vegetable biryanis.
the next day I came back to order another round of the same one and I told them about the mistake the day before, they immediately corrected the mistake by giving me a chicken biryani with the price of vegetable biryani.
the food is good but nothing special to be honest but the service is friendly and the free chai is more than generous.
the people that work here are likable and service oriented, and that is a huge difference maker.

and by the way, their Naan is incredible!
author: Rudy H.

description: Still delish- BUT, be aware that even if you order it as "medium" on the spice spectrum- you'll still be having flames shoot out your ears and nose.
author: Stacy S.

description: This is our most favorite go to Indian restaurant close to the financial district area. The owner Dilip is a great guy and always goes above and beyond to ensure our food satisfaction  Their naans are amazing and probably one of the best I've had in the entire Bay Area. Vegetarian must haves: Biryani, Achari Paneer, Saag Paneer and garlic naan!
author: Snehal S.

description:
Delicious! Awesome!
The best Indian food restaurant, have been so far w/ tremendous flavor-able curries, on top the service is amazing and friendly.
author: Salahuddin F.

description:
It's a small, reasonably priced place where you could go for lunch everyday.

Great fish curry and hot rotis are a great combo here. Their biriyanis are ok not very authentic.

It's definitely recommended if you want to try decent north Indian dishes.
author: Sundaram R.

description:
Indian place run by Nepali s who do an odd job to save the rare cravings but i hope they do a better jobs at that by committing fully and sticking to the age old recipes and traditions rather than cutting shortcuts and selling half baked stuff!

It's ok for a quick bite.
author: Auroshikha R.

description: I liked this place the first time, but I like it even more now. Everything said in my last review still stands, except this time I was given a decent amount of meat. I still got my go-to dish, lamb korma, but this time I decided to try it spicy-it's great that they give you the option to choose the level of spiciness. I chose the third level of spiciness, which was spicy, but not too spicy. Perfect amount of heat without having your mouth feel like it's on fire, lol. With the amount of food there is with the entrees plus rice and naan, you could def have it for two meals...which I'll probably do today :)
author: Meghan J.

description: We love the food here! Lots of delicious items. We love the Bindi Masala, Aloo Gobi, butter Chicken curry, and the korma. The portions part generous and the flavor is wonderful. Our only recent complaint (thus the four star rating) from last night was being told we needed more rice for a party of our size, but due to Americanized and diabetic diets, we just didn't need the amount that was insisted upon.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Delicious, delightful local Indian food. Chana masala was fresh and spicy, samosas had crunch, the vegetable biryani was plentiful and delicious too. The conical papadams were a nice touch.

Quick, lightweight, glad I came.
author: Janardan Y.

description: I am a vegetarian and I love their veg biryani ; dal, daal saag . I work in the city and enjoy getting my lunch from them .
author: Smitha S.

description:
I walked to Raavi from the Westin St. Francis on Powell and Post, based on the previous Yelp reviews and an unquenchable craving for legit Indian food. The Chicken Vindaloo was worth the hike through the sketchy Stockton bridge and the busy, colorful streets of Chinatown. Just the right amount of spiciness was cut down by basmati rice and simple naan bread. By the end of the meal, the heat of the Vindaloo sauce did not scald my mouth but, instead, lingered pleasantly on my lips :) 

The chai - if you order some - is hot, unsweetened spiced tea and only costs $1, although they claim it's "complimentary" before telling you the price which I found oddly endearing. It's self-serve so, that's nice as you can have as much as you'd like for the $1 you paid. Also self-serve is the water which is convenient if you can't handle your spice!

Speaking of self-serving, this is a no-nonsense place regarding service. You order and pay at the counter, get your own place setting and drinks and the servers simply bring your order to your chosen table when it's ready. For my part, I love hole-in-the-wall joints like this. No hovering servers but you never feel neglected either. When I needed a to-go container for my leftovers, the guys working the place were more than happy to oblige. If you're looking for a full-service restaurant, Raavi isn't for you but, if you're more independent, it'll do you just fine. 

If you're up for a stimulating walk through Chinatown or the down Kearny from the Financial District and in the mood for Indian food, I recommend stopping for lunch at Raavi. You won't be disappointed but, if you are, maybe try not to be so picky in life, hmm? Laugh, live, lunch!
author: Summer D.

description:
I work near this place and have been coming here for lunch with co-workers and had take-outs countless times over the years.  

I'm taking a star off for the new basmati rice formulation.
it's not cooked as fragrant and as colorful as before.  Something is just off since they changed from Naan-&-Curry to Raavi.  It was so good before I could literally eat them plain.  Raavi if you are reading this - REFORMULATE THIS ASAP!

Star off the price as it has definitely gone up, what used to cost around $7 is now approaching $10-11.    Can't really blame them for this with high rent and minimum wage, but when take-out reaches a certain threshold you start considering other alternatives.  $13-15 here, or have Japanese/American fare instead.

Dishes has more or less tasted similar, so that's a good thing at least.  Naan still taste the same too.
author: Drew B.

description:
I met a friend for a late after work dinner. It is a small self-serve place, not much in ambiance and style, but the food was great and inexpensive in San Francisco. I had the Chicken Saag. My first time and I loved it. I have nothing to compare to, but I enjoyed it. 
My friend had a vegetarian dish that I can't remember the name of but she said it was her standard way of telling if the place was good. It was. And the Naan bread was great as well.
We'll go back the next time she or I are in the mood for good Indian food.
author: Tony W.

description:
I'd like to start off and to say that this restaurant is a mix of Indian and Pakistani cuisine. Though the differences are minimal , pakistani contains beef and Briyani (a pakistani rice dish). This is what I love the most, it's a melting pot of two different cultures on one table!

I've ordered the:

Lamb vindaloo; can adjust degree of spiciness 
Yellow daal Tadka:lentils 
Garlic Naan and plain.

All for $28, yes decently priced! Great service and delicious varieties.

Highly recommended this place to newcomers.  As definitely must try
author: Zoey W.

description: The food was average. And the price reasonable. The location is great. I would go again. Staff is friendly.
author: Ronald M.

description: Really good Indian food for a decent price. Got the lamb korma and butter chicken and loved it! Also the garlic naan is a must. Favorite local Indian spot.
author: Cheng C.

description: Great curries, garlic naan, lacha paratha, complimentary chai, great prices. Under $30 for a big meal for two. On top of it they took us in when all the other restaurants in the area were closing.
author: Neha H.

description: I hate this place. I hate how the workers are horrible and I hate how good the food is. they only let you use card if the order is up to $10 and then he proceeded to make me buy a soda to get it up to ten dollars only to NEVER GET THE SODA
author: Xavier L.

description: Really solid Indian food. May not be the best it's a good value and the staff is very friendly.
author: Anthony B.

description: Horrible food and bad service. You have to pay upfront and then carry your own plate and cutlery to the table.
author: Ray L.

description:
Delicious Indian food at good price. Accommodating even when they are about to close.
You order quickly and the food comes as quickly.
Naan was delicious especially dipped in the scrumptious tikka masala. They are made to wed!
No visible after effects or stomachache afterwards. Keep up the solid recipes!
author: Jenny T.

description: I moved to SF two weeks ago with my fiancé and we've already gone to Raavi 5 times! It's a small, very casual restaurant and I was hesitant to eat there at first, but after reading reviews, we decided to try it and I'm SO happy we did! They have the BEST daal and naan I've ever had! My fiancé has had the chicken tikka masala and loves it too. The service is quick and they're always playing Bollywood music which sets the whole mood! We even ordered for delivery once after work and the food came hot and delicious. I know this will be our go-to Indian spot! Highly recommend!
author: Natalia J.

description: One of the best Indian places in the Bay Area. Quite good food always. Been here twice and the seafood and the other meat options are superb. Must recommend the chicken korma and the sea food.
author: Dishant B.

description: Great food and friendly staff! My go to is butter chicken with either the onion or paneer naan.
author: James A.

description: This joint makes my Tum Tum feel so good! The butter chicken is so Mmmmmmmmmm! All the food was straight out tha oven. My girlfriend would hate that I said this, but Raavi is Daannnkkkkkk!
author: Brian L.

description: I went with some of my friends, the staffs were friendly and service was good and clean but what matters me when I go to a restaurant is the food and am sorry to say, we didn't like the food. We ordered chicken biriyani, goat biriyani, stuffed chicken kulcha and stuffed lamb kulcha from which we could have only the chicken kulcha. If anyone wants to go here then I would suggest not to have the biriyani here. Sorry Raavi, you guys need to work on your biriyani and stuffed kulchas.
author: Somnath K.

description: If there is one restaurant you need to avoid in entire sfo for Indian food , this is it . Me and wife wanted to eat Indian food badly , took a cab to reach there and ordered shrimp biryani since she is a seafood fan and garlic naan and mutton curry for me . The biryani was extremely disgusting and was just chilli powder added to rice and shrimp . The mutton in the mutton curry had turned black , possibly due to constant reheating. I could not think anybody could make this bad food , the hygiene in this restaurant is extremely bad to complement the food . Please eat at your risk , pity the gullible people who love Indian food and get conned.
author: Gokul K.

description: This is the first time for me to come back to the place, since they had changed the ownership, I bring my friend to visit this restaurant, and we find that we go to a right place, not only the food, their place is clean, quiet, the cashier Binod is very nice to introduce their food to us with a warmth attitude, we feel free to enjoy the food and have a wonderful evening over there
author: Shirleen T.

description: Binad gave the best customer service Id had at a restaurant in a long time. The food is good and located in a great part of the city!!!!
author: Earl Alfred P.

description: the food is here absolutely fantastic and cheap! we ordered 5 dishes plus naan and biryani for 3 people and still had leftovers to take home! knocking one star for cleanliness (there were flies around the way area) and ambiance (seedy semi-soft porn Indian music videos playing on the big screen TV...)
author: Alexandra K.

description: I really enjoy the restaurant. Te food is delicious, my suggestion is karahai chicken and rice. The waiters are helpful, mainly Binod.
author: Fabiana M.

description:
I've probably been to this restaurant more than any other in SF (not counting late night Golden Boy). Anyways, Raavi is something special. 

Let's talk about the curry. The tikka masala is my soul food. Meaning - when I am sick, sad, hungry, or feeling the need to celebrate I crave this curry. You get a huge portion, and paired with a naan you have a seriously hearty meal. 

I've ordered maybe a half a dozen other plates here and enjoyed all of them. The food feels authentic, fresh, and always comes out piping hot (yessss).

The guy who works at the counter, Philip, is an absolute sweetheart who will try to cater to your needs. Since I've been going to Raavi, I've seen them consistently upgrade the restaurant - painting the walls, putting up pictures of the food, changing up the layout, and purchasing nicer dishware. It shows they care and I love that. 

Last bonus: the music videos on the TV are delightful.
author: Ainslee S.

description:
Palak paneer = spicy, salty and filling.  

Onion naan = hot, fresh and a bit chewy. It wasn't anything to write home about.

Rice = good. 

Free cup of chai with meal.

Service = self service. Order and pay at the counter. Then wait for the food for take out or for them to bring it to the table. Get your own drinks, silverware, napkins, etc.

Prices = reasonable. All of above was $11.96, with leftovers for another meal.

Overall, it was a quick place for Indian food.
author: Fannie S.

description: delicious food. so glad we came here. Ordered the shrimp tikka masala and chicken curry. Yum
author: Jasmine T.

description: The foods here are sooo yummy! And I did the catering in treasure island, and they sent the food so fast!!!
author: Qiyixin Z.

description: I've probably ordered from Raavi at least 3 times already, and each time does not disappoint. The food is relatively inexpensive and always tastes delicious. Some of my go-tos are the butter chicken, chicken tikka masala, paneer saaag, and garlic naan.
author: Alice S.

description: One of the best places to have Indian food in Financial district. Food quality is really good. Chicken tikka, butter chicken , Tandoori combo, biryani are must try. Also there new Rose lassi is amazing. Great food!!
author: Mayur K.

description: Excellent dishes especially in the non veg category. A must visit for everyone who loves indian cuisine!
author: Nibu A.

description:
We were told about the restaurant in the financial district. It could use a face lift on the inside, bathroom was in need of major facelift, but a lot of restaurants in SFO need something to make their restrooms user friendly. 

The food: 
We had chicken and lamb biryani which was delicious. One must be careful when ordering Indian food and the level of spices. Most western tongues are best left at the lower end of the spice level or the flavor of the food will be lost. Of course if you can take it ask for it. 

For desert we had Gulab jamun. It is very sugary sweet. I asked how they make it and they make it on site. Not something you can do easily in your kitchen at home by yourself. I highly recommend it.  

Staff was quiet but helpful, attentive. We spoke to the owner, Dilip who helped with ordering, very friendly. 

Prices were very reasonable $10 to $15 for numerous entries 

Can't go wrong with a first visit. See if you agree. Four stars because of the ambiance. 
Five stars for the food
author: Paul K.

description: The food is great but I'm on hour 2 of waiting for delivery when I live a 10 minute walk away. What is wrong with this place?
author: Dave K.

description: This place has real authentic Indian food. I've had the tandoori chicken and the garlic naan bread as well as the butter chicken. All of which was very flavorful! Definitely coming again and definitely recommend it. The prices are cheep as well.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Raavi catered our work event today. One word... aaaaammmmaaaaaaazzzzing!!!

There price point was appropriate,  and they delivered right on time.

Food was made so that everyone could enjoy. Not too spciy, to too bland.

Everyone went back for 2nds and 3rds.  Excellent food! 

Thank you.. we will be back!
author: brook t.

description:
the food was really delicious. their naans were super good and so fresh. I ordered palak paneer, daal and naans. over all I am satisfied

food 5/5
Ambiance 3/5
cleanliness 3.5/5
service 3/5
author: Heena C.

description:
Plenty of seating on a Friday night, easy to read menus, pricing is low to average compared to similar items across the bridge, and the service was good. 

We tried the chicken tikka, biryani, eggplant, and naan. We really liked their naan here. They were 10-12" in diameter, fluffy, chewy, with crunchy edges. The biryani was wetter than most places which also meant the the flavor was more even. The two remaining dishes were creamier than most we've tried but the flavors were rich and tasty though slightly heavier. Water and free chai were self serve too. 

We would definitely check this place out again if in the area.
author: Kevin H.

description: Surprisingly good. I have walked past this place for years without stopping. Their space is not overly inviting, and it always seems empty. But give it a try, the food when you do try it is excellent. Great comfort indian food, not overly rich, but nice bold flavors.
author: David T.

description: Amazing food, friendly staff, quick service, and cheap prices. Definitely worth many repeat trips
author: Alex W.

description: Chicken tikka masala was great with garlic nan and white rice for $14. Hot tea is a plus. Nice and simple place
author: Umba G.

description:
If you want good Curry this is your place. I've been coming here for years. Free Chai, good price. Great location. try the Achaer Curries, it uses pickled vegetables that give the curry a nice acid kick. One toasty fluffy naan is the perfect amount to soak up all the delicious curry. 
Always a nice peaceful meal here.
author: Adam G.

description: Food is great, but delivery drivers lack customer skills. I asked driver to leave food out front and he responded by stating not to purchase food from the restaurant again.
author: Rahel W.

description:
Went in with great expectations. This is one of the Indian/Pakistani restaurants when you get in when you will have the stale odor of curries.

Order - one roti, rice and lamb curry( waiters recommendation) and a free chai

Good - the roti was the best of the three.

Rice - was stale and not fresh.

Lamb curry - below average. 

The tea was good.

The total order costed 17$ with tips. The curry did not sit well in my Indian stomach :). So the 3 stars. I have to tell you that I have bit high standards for Indian food. If you are good hunter, Pakhwan in Fremont is perhaps one of the best Indian food in the Bay Area, don't judge the ambience. I am no way affiliated to the restaurant, have eaten there too many times and the food is consistently good. Anyway, have to find a good Indian restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: Shivaji D.

description:
Well prepared food with great depth and taste. I have always had a good meal here.

Try the palak paneer and butter chicken
author: Larry J.

description:
There is a sign on the door that says, "Pull Hard." This probably should have been a good indication that I would have to work for my food. 

Raavi (formerly Naan-n-Curry) has a very interesting DIY service model. YOU go to the self-service counter, YOU grab your own menu, and just after you order your food, YOU grab your own plate (the plates looked worn and in need of replacement), silverware, glass, napkins, beverages, etc. from a little shelf and adjacent cooler. Then, if you're lucky YOU find yourself a seat. 

There is minimal decor with mustard yellow and aluminum foil-colored walls. The floors were dirty. 

Unfortunately, the place seems to attract party-of-one-(maybe two)-corporate-lunching types, but almost all of their tables are configured to seat four people. This leaves three open seats per table, with virtually nowhere for a party of one to sit. Hmmmm.

I entered and walked to the back of the restaurant where I approached the cashier (who I believe was also the owner) standing under a "SELF SERVICE" sign. I said, "This is my first time here." He assumed I meant it was my first time eating Indian food (not even close), and pointed to the Chicken Tikka Masala. Explaining what it was, followed by, "It's a popular dish, and yummy." So, one order of "yummy" it was.

One thing I found slightly disconcerting is that the food got to my table before I did. Am I the only one who finds that to be scary? I mean...was it originally meant for someone else? Probably... it was pretty cold. I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala, Plain Naan Bread, and Basmati Rice. My total was $10.88 after tax and before tip (Note: A minimum purchase of $10 is required if you wish to use a credit/debit card).

Based on the previous indications, I wasn't expecting anything spectacular, so it stands to reason that Raavi "met" my expectations. The Masala sauce was the right consistency, but a bit too citrus-y. I expected more of a tomato, curry and spice flavor. It was seriously lacking in curry and spice. It tasted more like blended tomatoes, yogurt and lemon juice. The food was only warm, not hot. I like my Chicken Tikka Masala to be steaming hot. The chicken cubes were tender and not over-cooked like I was expecting in a stew-syle dish, which was the one and only pleasant surprise in my experience. The food was obviously made in bulk and not kept warm enough. The Naan was light, fluffy and soft like one would expect. The Basmati Rice was cooked perfectly, but again - cold. 

However, the place was pretty busy for lunch and there were no free tables, which leads me to believe that 1) People don't mind fighting a door for DIY lunch; and 2) There are actually no real spectacular Indian restaurants near the SF Financial District. This place and the two Indian food trucks that roam California St & Bush St are about as good as it gets? *Sigh* 

Aside from my food and experience being just ok, the guy across from me kept blowing his nose like he was in a foghorn imitation contest. (You win, Jackass, now take your no-manners-having-faux-hawk-topped melon somewhere else and blow whatever you want.) Gross. Some people are so uncouth. I lost my appetite and left before I finished my food, but by that point, it was practically ice-cold anyway. Even though the owner was very friendly, and the food wasn't horrible, I probably won't be back.
author: Heather A.

description: This place is so awesome! Wonderful, tasty food with friendly service. It's cool if you're looking for something quick and tasty, or to hang out casually with a group of friends. It's self-service style done right!
author: Jenni E.

description: One of my favorite Indian restaurants in he neighborhood! Always good Tikka Masala and complimentary chai.
author: Michael M.

description: Ordered four items. Mango lassi, always good. Glarlic nann, great when served hot. Potato bread. Very good. Chicken tiki kabob. Excellent.
author: Daveen L.

description: Excellent food, good indian music, excellent service of hospitality. Enjoyed Chicken Korma,  Chicken Tikka Massala and Lamb Biriani!!! Go ahead and order them! :)
author: Andrew I.

description: Really good food. One of the best restaurants in SF! Definitely try this place. Quick service good location.
author: Asad A.

description:
Great place to get delicious and affordable Pakistani/Indian food. Their naan is fresh, and goes well with any of the dishes. I had the Chana masala, naan, and samosas. Excellent combination. I also had their chai (made fresh) and it was very good.
Tasty and affordable, can't beat that combination in SF
author: Nabil N.

description: One of my favorite spots for Indian food, I've been a customer since 2013 when I lived close by, now I moved to nob hill n I come all the way here for their. Chicken tikka masala and lamb biryani. I love the food n the service. Ppl are very decent and helpful.
author: Mariam H.

description:
I ordered Bhindi Chicken and Naan
The Bhindi chicken looks like both the lady's finger and chicken cooked separately and added together and kept in oven. It does not taste good at all, very few pieces we find.
Naan is very hard to chew, bad. 
Fish curry was very worse, it was suggested by the girl who took the order. 
Palak panner has barely any palak we can eat 
Never go there while in SF
author: Mani S.

description:
Yes! Yes! Yes!

Raavi is THE BEST Indian restaurant in SF!Amazing food! Friendly service! Affordable prices! 

The chicken tikka masala is absolute heaven, especially paired with an order of rice and garlic naan. Feeling extra hungry? Don't forget the samosas!
author: Griffin S.

description: I ordered delivery from my hotel after a long grueling conference day and it was too dark and rainy and cold to go out.  It was delivered hot and relatively quickly and it was delicious!  The price was pretty good as well - I think I pay more for Indian food delivery in DC.  This was so good we scarfed down cold leftovers for breakfast two days later!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Eat here! Don't keep searching it may not look like much but this place serves the best Indian food I've ever had hands down.
