I don't often write reviews on Yelp, however I need the world to know how absolutely insanely good this joint is! I feel blessed that I only live a few blocks and can indulge when ever I please. Honestly this is the best restaurant in the area hands down.  Oh and let's not forget that every single person that works there is an angel. Affordable. Delicious. Filling.  

Pros - Everything 

Cons - I can't eat here for every meal. 

If I had to be nit picky I'd say the bathroom has some slight dungeon vibes. 

11/10 
/
101/100
author: Kristian G.

description: I came here for dinner while looking for pokemon and I was pleasantly surprised. All the dishes were spiced well and served very quickly. The portions are also very large for the price. The lamb saag and keema naan were great.
author: Michael V.

description:
My go to dish:
Butter chicken w/ garlic naan (sweet creamy tomato based. comes with dark meat)

Chicken tikka masala is similar but less sweet and comes with white meat.
author: Lily V.

description:
3.5 stars. The food is 3-4.5/5, ambiance is 2/5, service is non-existent (due to the take-out nature of the place) and overall value for money is 3 to 4/5.

Food - decent variety to pick from; portions are decent and the it's good stuff. The cauliflower and potato dish and the cheese naan are quite good; the fish curry isn't so tender sadly. Extra perk is you get a free cup of Indian milk tea with your order and in the fridge are huge tubs of water that you can take to your table (this is awesome) - the waiters are super chill and sometimes let you have unlimited refills.

Prices - for the price, the food is pretty good value, but then accounting for ambiance...

Ambiance - not that great, but it's more of a serve yourself sitdown restaurant
author: Amy G.

description: Over all food was fresh and quick. Large servings available which made it worth the money as it is on the expensive side. Needs tandoori mushrooms and papadums.
author: Holmes B.

description: I ordered the chicken combo lunch special with vegetable side today and the person taking the order did not speak English well and had trouble understanding me, so I pointed to menu on the wall, and said I'd like the vegetable side instead of the lentils.  He repeated chicken combo vegetable multiple times because I think he didn't understand.  Finally he put in the order, but he put in the wrong order.  It was only after I got back to my office that I saw they gave me the veggie combo.  I called and explained, but yet again he did not understand and kept saying yes, your order is ready.  I said no, I've already picked up my order, it's the wrong order and he keeps saying  yes, your order is ready. I asked to speak to someone else, and they too didn't speak english.  Eventually I hung up due to frustration.  The veggie combo didnt taste that great either and the salad had no dressing.  This is not a good way to run a business.   I know you've just lost mine.
author: C A.

description: So. Good. The matter paneer is delicious and just a little spicy, but you have to purchase rice separately (I didn't know this). The garlic naan is amazing and you get two big pieces for cheap. I got delivery, which was fast. All around a great experience.
author: Russ H.

description:
Great food, good portions, affordable, and great location. It was very difficult giving this place a 3 because the food is out of this world, but they didn't take my Groupon without an explanation. They also seemed to take awhile to open and set up the restaurant, causing us to wait outside for awhile. 

My friends and I had an amazing family style meal for lunch. We got samosas, mango lassi, garlic naan, fish karahi, chicken and lamb biriyani, bindi gosht, saag paneer, and tea. Every item was delicious. My favorite dish though was the fish karahi, which was very flavorful, juicy, and spicy, and the naan, which was also flavorful, warm, and soft. The 6 of us ate very, very well and had some leftovers. I was so full, I didn't eat anything for the rest of the day. 

You get tea with your meal, and it is a nice thing to finish your meal off with. The place is clean, simple, and casual. You are responsible for setting your own table with dishes, water, etc. As other reviewers have mentioned, this place isn't fancy but is just another casual Desi place. I am glad I got to try this place it is very popular among a lot of my friends, especially those who work nearby. 

I'll eventually get over my Groupon heartbreak, but I still am very disappointed in them for not sticking to their commitments. Another note, some of the workers don't get the tips you leave. I have friends who have been going for awhile, and they recommend leaving some of the tip on the table because the owners/management take the tips and won't give it to some of the other wait staff.  I loved the food, but some of their management practices make me not want to go back.
author: Nahila A.

description: Very solid lunch spot. Good value.  You will most likely have food leftover.
author: Zack H.

description:
The best Naan in town. 
The chicken Chika masala is fantastic
The price is unbeatable.
The place does not look like much but the food is fantastic.

Have enjoyed their food for 10 years now!!!
author: Anders N.

description:
It's hard to find an indian restaurant these days that don't upcharge the hell out of mediocre food by dressing up the ambiance. If you're craving just some home cooked Indian food on an unpretentious setting, maybe during lunch, or quick bite after work, this is your spot. My favorites are the lamb curry and the chicken tiki masala. With a side of basmati rice or naan, you're looking at $10. 

Go there. Eat delicious food. Have a nice day.
author: Steve L.

description: Great indian food. Lot of choices in menu. Nice owner. Restaurant is casual and well conducted
author: Sergio C.

description: delicious food and very nice costumer service. first time tried it with my family and their daal was soo yummy that we got a second order of it!!
author: Meena L.

description: The aloo palak and onion kulcha is an amazing combination.. Try it for sure and couple it with their free chai. Bollywood music in the background just completes the experience.
author: Sumana S.

description: I love Indian food and I am very critical of it and these guys really impressed! The baingan bharta was one of the best I've had and the palak paneer was fresh and tasty! The ambience is nothing fancy but the price was right and the service was good (the girl was sweet).
author: David C.

description: I just ordered a chicken Briyani from here! It's amazing! It brought me back to Mumbai where I lived earlier this year! Cheers.
author: Ana L.

description: This is a cafeteria style authentic Indian restaurant. The decor isn't fancy but it gets the job done. Prices are pretty reasonable. I ordered a paneer makhani which was very tasty and had a nice spice level. My mom got chicken tikka masala but felt the sauce was too sweet to really enjoy. The Nan was very large but not as buttery as I like it. I would go again for the paneer and service.
author: Maggie B.

description: Well, it was ok. On the good side, the food was tasty.   You go in and are told to sit down and look at a menu, but you must go up to the counter to order. We were the only ones there and they started vacuuming and mopping around us. We couldn't even hear to talk. Smh.   They brought the food and our order was incorrect. Instead of fixing it, he argued that we actually ordered the incorrect item. Smh. Brought the food with no serving spoons, utensils or napkins. Smh.     I'd say go somewhere else if you have the choice.
author: April R.

description: My meal didn't have a lot of flavor, I expected it to be spicy but it wasn't. And everything is self serve down to getting your own plates and silverware. If the food was more amazing I could get pass that but really it was just average. I would suggest finding somewhere else.
author: Hannah C.

description:
It's a good place . Prices are good , tikka masala , naan , briani is the best ! 
Very welcomed owner ! 

I live nearby and usually eat my dinner there ! 

Perfect place !
author: Jay M.

description: A colleague and I had dinner at Raavi last night. This was a chance discovery really, because we were craving Indian food and just wanted to go somewhere close to our hotel. Boy, weren't we happy! We found a hidden gem in San Fran, as far as Indian food goes. It's a small, quiet, simple place; no bells and whistles, but the food is excellent. And the owners and staff are very affable, pleasant, and hospitable young men. The place also has Indian tea, which you can help yourself to for free. Over-all, an excellent choice for Indian food in San Francisco.
author: Anil M.

description: One of the best Indian food Restaurants here at San Francisco. My family and I love this place since we first came in 2006. We really love the chicken tikka masala and Lamb Vindaloo, are very tasty. I really recommend this place.
author: Patricia G.

description: I have had the chicken tikka masala from Raavi and it's authentically Indian! They even play Bollywood movies inside. Portions are generous especially during lunchtime and my coworkers also frequent this place. Located in the center of FIDI, it is close by and has fresh ingredients. Looking forward to trying more of their options!!
author: Jovian C.

description: Really good food!! Price fits the taste/quality of food. Its near my school and definitwly worth visiting back when I crave something different. It can also be a go to place for celebrations.
author: Chris G.

description:
Wow! Where do I begin? I ate next door at Trestle on Friday the 18th of September 2015. As I was leaving Trestle ( that review I will write next ) I spotted this small Indian / Pakistani restaurant.

It is sparse inside. You order and then bring your own silverware and dishes to the table. 

We came in to order some Kebabs for our dog waiting in the car....as we were full from eating at Trestle. 

But the smells...and the Lamb Kebab we did buy were so good ( Please don't tell my cattle dog that I snitched a bit of her lamb ) that we made the decision to come back on the 19th for dinner. 

What a glorious feast we had. 

The Chicken Boti...my goodness.  You simply cannot believe how perfectly this dish is prepared. It was one of the best Indian dishes I have EVER had.

The butter chicken came out...and again...it was the simply the best butter chicken I have ever had. The sauce was more flavorful...more intense than any I've every had. 

The Palak Paneer...and Lamb Curry were good...but  the chicken dishes were off the charts. 

The garlic naan was done to perfection. 

The owner was a charming man who was very kind to my family. 

The chai was delicious...and the overall experience was made even better when the check arrived for under $40 bucks. 

If there is a better Indian restaurant in all of Northern California...I have yet to find it and I have been trying Indian restaurants for the past 20 years up and down California. 

When you toss in the portions...and the ridiculously low prices charged, this restaurant is simply the find of the century. 

A hidden treasure right under your nose San Francisco.

Still stunned. 

Well done Raavi!
author: Walter M.

description: Got some khadahi paneer and naan and it was really good! Highly recommend it if you are in the Chinatown area!
author: Sanchay G.

description:
This is a counter service Indian restaurant. You order and pay at the counter, but they do bring you your food. It's also BYOB, so bring along some drinks! We paired ours with Prohibition's Pale Ale and it went together really well.

The prices are relatively cheap, and the service was friendly. We ordered take out and we were offered complimentary chai while we waited. It was yummy.

We ordered the Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Tiki Masala, and Lamb Biriyani, and naan. Both main dishes were good.

The Lamb Biriyani was hyped up on Yelp, so we tried it, but that's the only dish I regret ordering. It was perfectly fine, but it was kinda pricey ($10) for what you get. There's hardly any lamb in it and it wasn't that flavorful and a bit dry. We would have been better off ordering the plain rice and saving $7. On the bright side, the portion was very large for this dish.

The naan was a tad dry too.

I still think overall this was about a 3.5 experience; but I think the chai and our two mains were good, and it's pretty inexpensive, so I rounded up to a 4. Its not mind blowingly good, but it's solid and I'd eat here again.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Amazing chicken tikka and butter chicken!! Love this place, definitely will be returning
author: Kelli N.

description: Awesome food!!! Highly recommended +++!!! The best nortern indian food that I have tried ever!!! You should visit this place and ask for the chicken tikka masala and chicken korma. The price was great and the size of the place was pretty good.
author: Anibal R.

description:
Just Okay. 

The food isn't bad. The portions are on the smaller side (think 5 pieces of paneer or lamb per dish) and the quality is just so-so. The naan was a bit dry for my preference, not chewy but rather crispy. Okay divey spot to grab a quick bite, but don't go out of your way to visit.
author: Nina M.

description: I like this place a lot. It is very casual and reasonably priced. I live nearby and this is a nice place to go if I don't feel like going to a full-service restaurant. It is very easy going and great for takeout.
author: Lindsey F.

description:
Excellent food and service / hospitality
I'm coming here for many years. Always loved the food. Nice people.
author: Abhay M.

description: I grabbed their Lamb Vindaloo and some naan while I was on my way out of town on a roadtrip. Everything was pretty good. Portions were pretty good but could've done with a bit less potato in the vindaloo.
author: Lauren K.

description:
I ordered chicken tikka masala for pick up.  When I got to Raavi, it was a little place.  Pretty plain place with not much to look at.  The good news is my food was ready when I got there about 10 minutes after I called.  That was quick!  The guy who rang me up barely said a word and wasn't too friendly.  I paid and then he disappeared before I finished typing my email into the iPad for a receipt.  

When I got back to my hotel, I opened the bag and realized my chicken tikka masala was a plastic bowl (plastic?  Isn't that unhealthy to serve hot food in?) of tikka masala with some chicken hidden in it.  There was also no rice with it.  Huh?  Every time I have had this dish before from other restaurants, the rice comes with it.  Luckily I had ordered naan bread to eat with it.  There was not much chicken and after I ate it all, there was more than half the bowl of sauce left.  The tikka masala was delicious and so was the naan bread!  If they weren't, I would have given the place 1 star for sure.  

Not sure if it's the norm for this place, but I was not very impressed with the customer service or small amount of food with no rice.  I give it 3 stars because it was quick and the food tasted great even though the presentation and quantity were lacking.
author: Mr S.

description: best indian food downtown.  like someone already said - no frills, just great flavor and fresh ingredients
author: Harbard T.

description: This restaurant had some amazing authentic Indian cuisine with large portions of food ensuring you get your money's worth. Would highly recommend to all Indian food lovers!!
author: Madison W.

description: Get the achaar chicken. Very good and close to the real deal. May be a bit spicy for most so you may want to ask them to tone it down a bit
author: ali r.

description: Mediocre food quality, mediocre service and place is not particularly welcoming. But the food is cheap by SF standards. And portions are big.
author: Suman C.

description: Raavi is definitely a good stop. Their garlic naan bread is particularly good, and we usually get the paneer tikka masala, which is also good. My reason for 4 instead of 5 is because i love paneer tikka masala that also encompasses some veggies, and this one is only the cheese cubes in the tomato type sauce. Still good though!
author: Kathleen C.

description: Self-service with fantastic chai (if it's relatively fresh). The chicken tikka masala is delicious and my favorite place for lamb seekh kebob.
author: Hillary S.

description: This was one of the most delicious restaurants that I've been to in a while. Incredible bread and the chicken curry tasted absolutely amazing. I liked it
author: Utku E.

description:
Delicious food at the resteraunt, also they have started veg and non veg combo during lunch hours which is absolutely amazing and economical (8/9$$)

A must try resteraunt in my opinion one of the best indian resteraunts in sf downtown
author: Rajat B.

description: Samosas with mint and tamarind sauce and a cup of steaming chai make for a perfect evening in San Francisco! I definitely recommend this place to satiate your Indian taste buds. PS: they also have the best biryani in the Bay Area.
author: Anuradha D.

description: Disappointing. Ordered Kadai Paneer via Uber eats--- came with negligible paneer cubes & gravy that's far from authentic.
author: Alex P.

description: Love the idea of a self service Indian place that's affordable and good. Great mango lassis too!
author: Maria L.

description: Great spot to get quick indian food for lunch. It's a small joint, but the prices are reasonable and service is friendly. I would definitely come back here again. :)
author: Hana D.

description: Definitely regret trying this place even though I yelped it beforehand. Food is subpar, but it's fast and cheap ($10 for two curries and rice). Huge vegetarian selection but it's probably one of the worst paki/indian meals I've had. Could not detect spices and tasted "mushy" for lack of better terms.
author: Ashley J.

description: Best hole in the wall Indian food place ever! I always come here and the service is really good. :)
author: Carmen C.

description: I love this place! Great price and friendly service, I always love the Palak Paneer and Garlic Naan!
author: Michael B.

description: Delivery took an hour and a half. Food was great though. Ordered the butter chicken and samosas. Samosas were delicious and butter chicken was alright. I would order from here again.
author: Amy L.

description: This place is clean and service is friendly. We normally order the chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, butter chicken, lamb curry, biriyani chicken, biriyani lamb among other things. The food is still pretty good but the chicken tikka masala was not as good as I remember. Maybe the chef was just having a bad day. Will be back for more!
author: Lily T.

description:
Do I like everything on the menu?    Nope
But the items  I like are better here than elsewhere.
Onion Naan - Paneer Tikka Massala(veggie) -  Boti all very tasty.
Anything done in  tandoor  oven is perfect.
Lunch super busy, you can order to go ahead of time to 11 pm yes open to 11pm.
Everyone that works there is very nice, and  the prices  are perfect.
Thanks
author: Roxanne Y.

description: Butter chicken is my fav...BUT this is the 1st time I've had butter chicken and it tasted like spaghetti sauce. Pissed I paid $10.50 for this, maybe 5 pieces of chicken in the sauce. The garlic naan was good but I really had the taste for Indian NOT Italian. I'm irritated.
author: Natasha H.

description: Mild spicy chicken tikka masale, GOOD! did pick up, was fast. 3 curries and 3 naan=$25, plenty for 3 people at a bar!
author: Miss J.

description: Buttered chicken was really good, better then there masala imo. Best part about this place is complimentary chai.
author: Mohammed D.

description: Great location to Chinatown when you don't feel like eating Chinese some days!  Self-service style works well for lunchtime. Delicious hot tea. Beautiful presentation of food. Nice variety and wonderful flavors you would expect with Indian food.
author: Diane G.

description: Consistently great. Amazing food at great prices for SF. Plus, they've been early every time I've ordered their delivery! Excellent, highly recommend the paneer tikka masala. Da bomb.
author: Kate J.

description: We love cheap eats. But don't let the looks of this place fool you: the decor is hole-in-wall, but the food is absolutely luxuriously flavored. The fish melted in my mouth, served with crisp fresh tomatoes and onions on the side that wafted in a complex dance into my nostrils. The Chicken ghobi (with cauliflower), and a side of yellow lentil rich in interplay of raw, roasted and simmered spices that  stood on their own. And the heaping plate of vegetable biryani, enough to feed a family of 5, worked so well you'd think the rice and vegetables grew up together and immigrated to America just to open a restaurant. It gave the meal a foundation that built on the best of indian and Pakistani kitchens. Eat here if you're serious about great, honest south Asian food.
author: David F.

description: Just found a cockroach in my co-workers curry from here.  So horrible!  We were so shocked.  This place is really popular and it's a shame to see this happen.  Totally unacceptable and disgusting.
author: Sam T.

description:
I used to not like eating Indian food, but Raavi has me hooked! Other SF Indian restaurants do not compare. It is so reasonably priced compared to other places in the city. 

Keep on keepin' on Raavi! 
From your #1 fan.
author: Ellen H.

description: We love this Pakistani-Indian food and the prices can't be beat.  Really great naan - get the onion naan, in particular, it's delicious.
author: Samuel F.

description: I wish I could give this place a minus 5. This is our first time in San Francisco and we ordered food here based on other reviews.  We ordered veggie dishes and they all taste the same.  It appears as though the gravy stock is the same and they just change the additions.  Never again.
author: Sunil P.

description:
Although I thoroughly enjoyed the food I had yesterday at Raavi, one thing I witnessed completely made me lose my appetite. I stopped eating immediately, pretended I was full, and just hoped my guests didn't notice the cockroach climbing up the wall behind them. To no avail however, one of them did notice and was keeping it quiet just like I was. I couldn't sleep just thinking about how the food I ate over dinner was likely infested with cockroach feces and lord knows what else. The bathroom, which is down a flight of stairs, is unlike any other. Horrifying gross. And the smell is unlike any other. If anyone here on yelp has ever been to a refuge camp in the middle east, the bathroom at Raavi is exactly the same... which is pretty crazy to see here in U.S...but maybe my shock could be attributed to the fact that I'm not a native city dweller.

Anyway, never coming back here due to the roach and the bathroom. I hope this place gets hit by a health inspector asap.
author: Mariam A.

description: I was in the mood for something not super authentic, so I went with the paneer tikka masala. The lady taking my order was really rude, she basically snapped at me when I was telling her what I wanted. The food was pretty much what I expected, nothing particularly special about it. I was a little frustrated that the dish didn't come with rice, and I wasn't told this when I was ordering. Furthermore, the place is almost unsettlingly dirty - I just didn't get a good vibe about the place. The samosas were decent though.
author: Amaresh S.

description: This is my favorite Indian place in the city! Good portions, good service, and clean place at a great a price. Would recommend!
author: Eleen Y.

description: Had a delicious chicken biryani.  I used to eat once in a weak.cheap and tasty food in Bay Area.and the service was too good.
author: Binod P.

description: Decent dirty paki food a la pakwan. The CTM is reminiscent of spaghetti-o's. Saag was better. Free chai and good value.
author: Andrew K.

description: Most indian restaurants I have tried in San Francisco fail to deliver the authentic taste from back home. But Raavi is an exception as their food has the right 'masala' making it stand out from the rest of the places I have eaten at. Their best dishes are, undoubtedly, saag paneer, chana masala, and their hidden gem - Dal Makhnini.
author: Prem B.

description: Amazing cheap food in a usually expensive city. Highly recommend the butter chicken with rice and naan. Very filling and comes under $15
author: Ugo C.

description: If you like Indian food, then you'll love the food here! Very tasty! It's very original and I would come again to eat here!
author: Kim H.

description:
We were craving Indian last night and this popped up on our search for the area and since it had a decent star rating we figured we'd check it out. The entrance is a bit hard to locate initially, it's kind of squashed between other businesses around it and the front is pretty nondescript and the restaurant inside is small, but it's worth looking for if you're leaning in the Indian direction and are around Little Italy.

There's two seating areas, one in the front and one in the back that's a little more secluded. We chose to sit in the back area since there were a few families up front and a lot of noise and we wanted a bit of quiet. You order and pay at the cashier in the back and they'll bring your food out. You have to serve yourself your own water from the fridge where they keep the pop and other drinks, but they brought my mango lassi out to me within a minute of us ordering and sitting down.

That's one big thing going with for here... the service is *fast*. We ordered a paneer and chicken tikka masala, a rice and a garlic naan, plus my mango lassi. I think we had all our food out within 5 minutes of sitting down. It was hot and fresh.

Portion sizes are a bit on the small side, in my opinion. Then again, I did eat everything in front of me and wasn't hungry in the least. The price is also quite excellent ($21.00 for the two of us). 

We both enjoyed our tikka masalas and the mango lassi is probably the second best I've had in the city, but the garlic naan was mind-blowing. Hot and covered in large chunks of garlic, it came out as an uncut slab and was very much the winner of the evening. I went through that far faster than rice with my curry. I would have been completely happy ordering two naans instead of one and a rice.

Definitely a good Indian food option if you're looking for fast and well priced.
author: Cassandra J.

description: It doesn't look like much on the outside but holy guacamole this food is amazing! We ordered the chicken tikka masala and chicken curry with plain naan and it was some of the best Indian food we've had. Raavi is also very affordable which was a huge plus! Definitely recommend!
author: Jenna J.

description: The service on this place is horrible. They keep mixing orders and don't pay attention to the customer time. Recently I went to the place and order panner tikka masala, and after the long wait and few reminders I got my order. And almost when I was about to eat it I realized it was chicken tikka masala. Horrible!
author: Rohit J.

description: By far the absolute best Indian food I've had in SF! I've lived here for 25+ years, and as a vegetarian, Indian is one of my "go-to" cuisines and Raavi just gets it right - their samosas are perfectly cooked, with a crust a baker would be jealous of; the aloo vindaloo isn't just hot, it has a complex melange of spices giving it depth, the daal is rich, the aloo gobhi has super tender potatoes and cauliflower - then there is the amazing naan, and what has to be hands down the best basmati rice I've ever had at an Indian restaurant in this price range. They're so good I order from them almost every single week. I cannot recommend them enough!
author: Eric S.

description: Best Indian food in the city!!! I love the tikka masala, samosas, and mango lassi. And you absolutely must have garlic naan with your order. This place is super fast with either takeout or dining in too. They have delicious free chai while you wait!
author: Brianna W.

description: Ordered take out from here and everything came still hot and fresh. Would recommend if you are looking for good indian food. Am looking forward to going to eat at the restaurant and requesting for it to be more spicy! The eggplant dish (baingan bartha) is yummo!
author: Stine H.

description: I ordered delivery and had myself yelled at because I didn't walk down a block to pick up my order from his car. When I recovered to actually look at my package, it turned out it belonged to someone else. I am vegetarian and had chicken and other meat stuff delivered. I would have told the guy, but he was too angry to wait a second and just stormed off. Scary, I would rather stay away!
author: Vegan F.

description:
@@ party if one for lunch@@
Food can't get any better, staff (owner) is very friendly and easy going! It's a typical casual Pakistani restaurant so nothing fancy, self service ( even silverware and napkin) restroom is down in the basement (San Francisco!) food variety is good and again it is amazing and must try!
You can't go wrong with chicken tikka masala
author: Sherif K.

description: Good Indian/Paki food in the Northbeach neighbourhood. Friendly and hospitable folks and good Indian music and videos playing all the time.
author: Mike F.

description: one of my favorite Indian places at sf. they serve such a good food and have really big plates,which is really important for me,cause I'm man and like to eat. have to say chicken tikka masala is so yummy that I'm gonna ready to it it with dish))) thank guys for service
author: Vadim R.

description: The first Indian/Pakistani Restaurant I tried out in San Francisco, and I'm so glad I came here. Amazing Indian food, wonderful kind service and a lovely Indian atmosphere make this place a must-go for just about anyone in SF who'd like to try out some delicious Indian dishes. Very highly recommended.
author: Vishnu S.

description: I went there this week for the first time and was very pleased to find a good local lunch time Indian/Pakistan spot. I was accompanied by some co-workers so we ate family style. Food was delicious and the price for 3 was very reasonable.
author: Manuel M.

description: This place is amazing.  Been going there since 2005 about once a week.  Been regulars ever since.   Good value and friendly service.  Religiously like this place.
author: Roger T.

description:
Food was good and not that costly also.
Naan were really big and tasty. The combo with Bindi masala was perfect to my taste.
Must visit if you are into Indian breads
author: Suhas H.

description: Great Indian food at a good price.  Not huge in portion but not really needed as we order many dishes and enjoyed every single one of them!  HIGHLY recommend this place.
author: Winford D.

description: Yeah it does taste good but what they are making is not safe for eating. They are adding some sort of colors and the moment I finished food, I got terrible nauseous feeling. Yeah food poisoning it was. So they do know how to make tasty dishes, they are not using the best vegetables spices rice to make it. I am pretty sure there are cockroaches running all around the place. The oil they use is below standards. Come on guys, do you really have to get stomach ulcers just to save a few bucks?
author: Archi B.

description: Awesome...just awesome...   Their lamb tikka masala is the tastiest I have ever had.  The curry is so creamy and rich I could drink all day long and even use it as a lubricant...
author: Mason W.

description: Delicious food and great service.  I went in there for carryout and they forgot to put my appetizer in the bag, when I got home and noticed I gave them a call and they delivered a double order of the missing item to my apartment.
author: Amir R.

description: We went there around 3PM (30 minutes after their Veg combo/thali closes). We ordered for items from the menu including 2 Naan. We were surprised that we were served a reheated Naan unlike a fresh one which was served to other guests. We couldn't bite the naan. I daily have naan or rotis during my lunch and Raavi's Naan was an awful one. Surprised how could they serve a reheated naan which is very difficult to chew itself (forget swallowing). Glad, i didn't visit on a Valentine's day, else that would have been my last date for suggesting this place. I would suggest others to stay away from this place and try other restaurants nearby.
author: Sandip K.

description: Ordered plain rice$2, keema nan bread$4, chicken tikka breast $5/6. Came to about $10/11 Everything was very nice and tasty, quick service, friendly staff. Thought keema nan would have red meat in as that's what I get in the uk Indians but was nice still, bigger portion of rice would have been better. It would be great if they could do specials such as any starter/main meal(curry)/desert(or chips)/any rice/any nan for under $ 15 . I got it for takeaway but you could eat in the restaurant.  I would recommend!!!
author: Daniel M.

description: I have been a fan of this restaurant for many years.  The Indian food is great a day the prices are very reasonable
author: Jonathan J.

description: love,love,love this place.  The food is so good and so affordable.  They will get 5 stars as soon as they scrub the floor and upgrade the bathroom.
author: T S.

description: I ordeered lamb biryaniiii and there were literally 3 pieces of lamb in the whole biryani. I get it ,lambs are expensive but why dont you charge extra 2 dollars and put suffecient amount of lamb in the food.
author: Jason M.

description: Decent place. Nothing special. Nothing too horrible. Just about an average place but then there aren't many indian places in north beach.
author: Sahil B.

description: Nothing great about food but prices are not that high too. If you want something quick to eat and don't want to spend too much time then this place is good.
author: Nikhil A.

description: Loved this place so much I went here twice while visiting SF.  Some of the best Indian I've had in awhile.  Liked the self serve nature as it keeps it affordable.  Nothing too fancy or appealing about the decor but who cares when the food is this good.
author: Elissa H.

description: Tasty, not too fancy, but not that super fantastic.
author: Pavan G.

description: Hands down one of the best chicken Biryani I have had in San Francisco. They seem to have mastered the art of cooking the most flavorful, well cooked rice with the perfect blend of spices. The portions are generous and the staff is friendly and courteous. Nothing beats the taste of my mom's home cooked Biryani back in Pakistan, but this one is a winner here in the city :)
author: Abdus S.

description: Fantastic food. Great taste. Worth every penny spent. I must say this place has been a life saver for me.  It has variety for both vegetarians and non vegetarians. Particularly the matar paneer curry and chicken tikka masala. Has the best samosa in the city. It has also started lunch combo for students..I would so recommend this place to all
author: Gaurav A.

description: One of the truly authentic Indian cuisine restaurants in SF. Consistent taste and great staff. Truly a homely feeling for Indian students and a delicious quick-pit-stop for tourists! Oh wait, the prices here will just keep you coming back for more!!
author: Raj M.

description:
Surprisingly tasty! It's not fancy, a bit of a hole in the wall. Unfortunately they do not offer my favorite dish of butter chicken but the tall, nice man offered to make my chicken tikka masala spicy for me. 

The garlic naan was delicious! So tasty and crispy and warm and garlicky...Yum!

I suggest this place to anyone look for a super casual quick yummy meal. Good place to go if you just want a quick meal on your own.
author: Alanna R.

description: I was not expecting much from this restaurant after checking other reviews, and it was really true when I visited. The Naan was too hard and the Chicken Tikka Masala was tasting soar, my friend ordered Biriyani and by the look & taste it was too far below moderate.
author: Vasu V.

description: Just finished an attempt to eat chicken vindaloo. The chicken was neither identifiable nor edible. Wouldn't feed it to my dog. Buyer be ware.
author: Steve M.

description: Finally caught them open. The food here is passable if you're really craving Indian, but definitely uninspired. The atmosphere is terrible. Everything is self-serve, including getting your own water and silverware. They also don't give printed receipts. You have to get one emailed from Square. Ok for "fast food" Indian but avoid if possible.
author: Robert F.

description: Went here on a recommendation to find good Indian food by looking for a place that advertises Pakistani as well. The food is excellent and the ambience has a local feel to it.  Most of the customers seemed like regulars and the folks behind the counter were very friendly.  I had the chicken tikka masala and plain naan.  Its take out style with self service table settings, no frills.  I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area.
author: M M.

description:
I got the kadhai chicken and roti. Though the owner said that the biryani was everyones favorite. 
Was pretty spicy (not hot, but spicy).
I really liked it. Though, it is not everyone's cup of tea.
Also, I'd say the serving size was large-ish.
author: Nakul J.

description: Very good food and good service...loved the chicken curry we had for lunch. A hidden gem.
author: Gopinath S.

description: I had an opportunity to check out this little place, for some takeout. I got some rotis, the bhaingan bhartha and the chicken vindaloo. The bhaingan was average; the vindaloo was pretty good even thought it was a bit surprising to see meat with bone in it. As other reviewers have mentioned, the ambience isn't great and you have to pick up your own utensils. Things which don't matter, I suppose, when you are getting takeout. The waiter was really friendly and asked me to try the chicken achar next time...something I intend to do. All things considered, it's worth another trip.
author: Vijay K.

description: Great food, very friendly people.. It has become our daily stop for Indian food. Their achari paneer , bhagara baigan are a definitely worth trying.
author: Vamsi Krishna T.

description: Really solid place in the neighborhood. Been coming here with my sister for a few years! Really recommend this place during cold weather to warm yourselves up!
author: Jacky C.

description: Had chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, basmati rice and saag paneer. Everything delicious!!! This is a order at the counter, take a number, get your own plate and silverware and water place. Good food, just not at all fancy... Got all the above for $19 and I will make 2 meals out of it!
author: Donna B.

description: Great place to go and their food is really good for a good price.... My family and I always love going there. The environment is great
author: Genesis R.

description: I tried the lamb tikka masala and regular naan. Quick friendly service and good food. It's on the cheaper end of pricing which was nice. The dining area was a bit worn, but it matches the pricing. I would recommend this place for a casual meal.
author: John W.

description:
Few good things about this restaurant : 
1. BEST SAMOSA in town: 
    I am indian and have ate samosa's at various places but this place is amazing . 

2. Panner tikka masala is delicious:
    Panner ( cottage cheese ) was really well cooked. 

3. Good cheese naan: 
     You will love cheese naan at this place ...they really are best at it.

4. Price : Best price in the city . For 12$ you will have good meal with ( rice , naan , gravy).

I visit them every alternate day.
author: Jaydev C.

description: Out of the many places i visited to eat in SF, Raavi was a place I had to go back to. Delicious, cheap, and you can bring in your own beer. What more could you ask for?
author: George H.

description: its ok. i got it through meal -pal . channa and rice. he could have put a second dish in there. the place itself does not look that inviting. indian places always look so dab or over the top. maybe its too many rich VC's competing for the look. whatever it is, the food is ok- ok- meaning i didnt have any painful effects later- sad when thats how we rate food. but SF for all its food places- is ridiculously over-priced. the food - channa- was okay but nothing great
author: A N.

description: We stopped in for food, spur of the moment. They didn't disappoint! The food was great and the people working were very nice! I will definitely come back if I'm this way again!
author: Sheng Z.

description:
This place is what used to be Naan n Curry. The menu almost exactly mirrors what their menu used to be. Service was nice and friendly! Food was like any other Indian food. It was good enough to satisfy my craving. 

I couldn't finish my order so I asked for some boxes to pack it up and that was great! A plastic container for my curry and a box for my naan. Plus they also have plastic bags available! Who wants to walk around Chinatown holding individual containers... I don't juggle, I drop.
author: Kristina L.

description: I ordered from here on Eat24 and the restaurant stole my credit card information. DO NOT EAT HERE
author: Allie Z.

description: Love this northern Indian cuisine. Delicious and authentic and affordable and open late. Friendly people and vibe.
author: Charles C.

description: Odd little space where we get our own plates,  cups, silverware, and water....order from the counter and wait at the table. They allowed other beverages to come in and my friend brought on her own food,  no issue. Chicken curry was OK, chicken Tikka OK, samosas & naan were yummy.  Overall, good.
author: Vanessa W.

description: First time here & Expectations were met and all the dishes were perfect! No one complained in the table. Love it here and totally recommend it.
author: Cici C.

description:
(I'd probably do 3.5 if I could).  I love this place.  I go here at least once per week if not more and seriously get the same exact order every single time: Paneer Tikka Masala, side order of rice, and naan.  Some of their food is a bit spicy but they can usually make it not spicy.

My reasons for dinging it are that it isn't particularly nice (the restaurant); in fact, it is a bit grungey.  The cashier(owner?) is nice though and they seem to have a very hard working staff.  I always do take-out and have never eaten there so my review would maybe change based on that.
author: Banana S.

description: LOVE this place! Moved to Chinatown in August and this is totally one of my two go-to spots (along with House of Xian Dumpling) for delicious, affordable food. The boys who work there are so rad and sweet, the curries are amazing, very homey and comforting food. It's so easy to go unnoticed but I'm telling you it's one of the best places to dine in the neighborhood, even if it's not Chinese!
author: Andrew S.

description:
One of the most Authentic Pakistani Food. The staff is very friendly and they sometimes customize your order if you ask them to make it more spicy or less. The food quality is good and fresh. 
It's good place to eat till late night in Financial District. 
Cheap, fast and good
author: Komal K.

description: Friendly staff, food is priced just right and tastes good. Great place to go to if you're looking for Indian food near the north beach/Chinatown area.
author: Jackson N.

description: Great service and menu options. Prices were the bomb diggity. Very convenient and the staff was very friendly!
author: Weston P.

description: I visit this restaurant often and I love the Baingan bharta and veg. biryani. The Naan is also well prepared and served fresh. Would recommend it to everyone. A great value for money restaurant in this location.
author: Nitin L.

description: The worst ever biryani i had in my life is at this place. Quality doesnt match the price. I recommend not to try this at all.
author: Sankeerth D.

description: Been eating here for past 6 months.. Excellent food at affordable price... There Mango Lassi and kadhai prawn are my favorite..Also their aloo Naan is a must try.
author: Afsa Y.

description: Being vegetarian, liked this restaurant a lot in the area. Awesome food, specially Baigan bharta and kadai paneer. Great and quick service with friendly staff. Will be coming back again and again when desi food in need.
author: Amit K.

description: Very good Indian food! Perfect dinner on a beautiful evening out with my family. Don't miss it.
author: Ben W.

description:
I often visit this place and all the dishes I have tried so far are good and tastes far better than other Indian food places in the neighborhood.  Owner in an  extremely cool and nice guy and sometimes even provides seasonal dishes.

Prices are very reasonable, food is not too spicy nor blend and has perfect taste to it.  Their Chicken Seekh Kabab  & Naan's are just AWSOME !!!
author: Deepak B.

description: If you're looking for food/Value place where it's based on self service, this is it! The food is full of taste without too much spices. The prices are a really good deal for the quantity you're getting. The garlic Naana is amazing especially when you're dipping it with the Chicken Tikka Masala! The one downside of this place is the cleanliness , making it taking a star out. A place I definitely would recomend to anyone local or just passing by( like myself ).
author: Gabi D.

description: Good, cheap Indian. Hit the spot for lunch as I have been craving Tikka Masala. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Sarah A.

description: THIS PLACE IS THE MOST FANTASTIC Indian food in FIDI. The curry is delicious. You'll be overwhelmed with spice. and Adnan has great service skills.
author: Sara G.

description: The chicken masala was sweet so it's fitting for those who do not like spice. If you ask for spice, they'll make it spicer. The pricing is fair and the workers are engaging and nice. I recommend coming here for everyone.
author: Kevin H.

description: If you ever tasted Hyderabad dum biryani and you love it,I'm pretty sure that this place is not for you..I love have authentic Hyderabad dum biryani.I was hoping to get to eat at Raavi..Oh man !! They used tamarind for making biryani.Thats not even Dum biryani.They didn't gave any gravy for biryani.I was there with my friend and we have ordered Kheema naan.Kheema naan was the worst part of our lunch..
author: Sujay K.

description: Something of a dive - even by dive standards. Don't know if I've ever eaten in here. But the best Indian I've found bar none. First became addicted when my office was a block away and we catered office lunches from here. Now I live 35 miles away, but we regularly pick up large quantities to bring home for dinner (and for additional meals after) when my wife or I are in the city. No place else comes close.
author: Joel H.

description:
Super cheap and fast delivery. Located in Jackson and Columbus street. It's usually full during lunch hours. All in all a fun gathering to have lunch/dinner.
Upside: Good food, free WiFi and free Tea.
Downside: Crowded at lunch time.
author: Mohsin K.

description:
This place offers some good dishes, if you're not finicky about the ambience. Personally i liked the naan and the lamb vindaloo. I'm taking one star off because of the customer service. If you go there in odd hours,  their customer service is super slow and it seems like the cook is the only guy in charge. I mean it's understandable the customer influx is low but still you gotta feel for the guy. 

Overall not a bad place to eat and not so heavy on your wallet. Better than other Indian places out there.
author: Roy R.

description:
Ordered for pick up, somehow they messed up my order and told me that I was wrong. I don't understand how ground chicken is the same as cut up chicken tights. The cashier was on her cell phone talking to someone about paying off her debt with a loan. All she said to me "did you pay?" and "I didn't take your order". I also order prawn curry that costs $11 but they gave me a little container with three over cooked prawns. 

I honestly don't understand how this place has so many stars. There were only 5 people eating there during the lunch rush. I will never go there again or order there for my office.
author: Anna O.

description: Food is excellent and good value (lamb, rice and naan for $16). Staff is busy but very helpful.
author: Marc N.

description: The food is very oily, but they give large portions, and I always need food for lunch and dinner since I work late into the evening.
author: Earl B.

description: Good place for lunch in San francisco. Good ambience and music. Staffs are friendly. I usually go to this place. They have a combo offer which is really reasonable and delicious.
author: Samiksha D.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the food here, it was probably the best Indian food I've ever had the chance to consume! My only wish would be that I lived much closer to here...
author: Andy A.

description: Good non pretentious Indian food. Try the lamb kadhai. The only complaint is that they didn't tell me that the chicken entree I was ordering was a dry dish and more of an appetizer.
author: Rohit B.

description: The food is authentic, delicious and inexpensive. The Tikka Masala is one my favorites! Try it out and the garlic naan.
author: Marc P.

description: This is my go to place when I work overtime. I love the Chicken Tikka Masala and Naan. Very friendly staff. I ordered online and was ready within 15 mins.
author: Ms. Lashay T.

description:
I wish there was an option for 6 stars!
Raavi is not only one of the tastiest Pakistani/Indian places in SF, but also has the nicest people. 
If you don't know what to order just ask and be amazed.
author: Sheron P.

description: A large meal of authentic good quality & outstanding value/price, in this part of SF? Unheard of. One of my favs & regular spots in NB.
author: Shane K.

description: I loooooove the food here. Best tikka masala in the city. The manager is gruff but kind. I really love going to this place, and have since it was Naan N Curry. Nothing but the name seems to have changed.
author: Morgan M.

description: Ordered Chicken Tikka Masala all over the country but this is the only place that charges extra for rice! Food was good and you get a lot of Naan bread if you order it. Easily 4/5 if not for the rice shakedown.
author: Chris K.

description: awesome chicken achari! cheap for the area it is in.. must try if you looking out for amazing Indian food.
author: Ketan R.

description:
Sometimes you go to a hole in the wall and find a gem. This wasn't the case here. 

I eat Indian food frequently, and usually base my opinion on their chicken tikka masala. The sauce was decent, but the chicken was dry (maybe even a little burnt?). The paner naan was good and massive (large portions all around for naan, dishes, and rice). 

If you're in a pinch for Indian food then go for it, but don't expect the best Indian you've ever had.
author: Chris J.

description: Am only writing this as a way to combat boredom, as the takeout food I was told would take 15 minutes has taken more than 35. Two of the simplest dishes on the menu. I could have flown to Karachi and got it faster. Ugh.
author: Ash S.

description:
Don't expect fancy, white linen table cloth and fine wine but if you're looking for very good Indian/Pakistani food, this is the place to come.

This place used to be Naan & Curry but the manager bought out the previous owners and corrected what was missing from the original formula...customer service and fresh food that's made to order.  N&C had all their food made in the tenderloin restaurant and then brought here in plastic buckets.  The food was then reheated when the order was placed.  Well, not anymore.  All the dishes are freshly made to order.  The naan is the best in town if not in CA.  It is large, slightly crispy outside and soft & fluffy inside.  It's baked in a real tandoori oven not in a pizza oven like others.  Ask to see their tandoori ovens, I'm sure the new owner "Atta" wouldn't mind.  They also have special dishes that are not on the menu like aloo keema (curry potato & beef) or slow cooked curry lamb shanks.  Damn, I'm getting hungry just describing it!  Oh, unlike other Indian/Pakistani restaurants, the chai is always free to customers...save some for me!
author: Robert K.

description: I loved this place when it was Naan & Curry and I think I love it even more now. Some of the best food I've had and they pack it well for to-go orders (which is how I usually get it). Can't go wrong with the Chicken Tikka Masala, an order of rice and a naan. Hits the spot every time.
author: Russ M.

description:
You must visit this place at least once to have homely food of Indian and (Pakistani?) choice. I loved this place in couple of occasions. And Raavi is so good in his hospitality.

Prices are reasonable too!
author: Susanta K.

description: Great authentic Indian ... Counter service with a seating area ... Full bold flavors if you have the palette for that sort of thing .... If you do you won't be disappointed ... Please note this is not a fine dining eatery
author: Rob H.

description: Horrible chicken biryani I ever had in my life.i think the positive reviews and stars kept by themselves only to attract customers.-5 stars
author: Srav M.

description: Favorite place in SF! Insane quality, fast and practical. Highly recommend the Mixed Vegi Tikka Masala, which tastes like God, Bhudda, Ganesha and a bunch of saints combined.
author: Bruno S.

description: I'm here every week. Best deal for Indian to go in the FiDi/North Beach area. Friendly ownership and staff. Everything is good.
author: Adam S.

description: For the money, you cannot find a better Indian restaurant in San Francisco.  The decor is not fancy but the food is fantastic.  At one point this was a Naan-n-Curry and luckily the change in ownership has not impacted the quality or value.  If you haven't been, its definitely worth a visit.
author: David T.

description:
best indain food ever 
great layed back service
went with my mother we were head over heels
author: Radzh E.

description: Awesome food! The place is nothing fancy and we were the only diners when we arrived at 7pm on a Wednesday, but the meals were excellent - they arrived quickly and with a satisfying level of heat (which can be a problem in some places). Definitely would recommend.
author: Laura M.

description: Filthy place. No hygiene. Rude and unco-operative staff. Do not go even if you are dying of hunger. North beach is close by. Any other place is a good option.
author: R V.

description: Naan?? Naan??? Yes please. Lamb biryani bomb!! Free chai with meal and it is very solid! Come eat for cheap, no frill Pakistani Indian!
author: Yenvy P.

description: I've been eating here on average 3x per week for several years. I love this place. I love the Gobhi Chicken. I love the staff. It never gets old. As a note, I've been really into weightloss and the gobhi chicken is acceptable in most diets. I've lost 43 lbs. Eat the gobhi chicken. Trust me.
author: Dana W.

description: I mean really?  an indian restaurant named after ravii shankar? doesnt get much better than that! delivery guy nice!? wow shocking. Food delivered without spilling (curry!!) fantastic!  and that black lentil goodness i have never tasted before like that!  oh and i almost forgot: no.. the samosas are not too salty. They are salty but not too salty.
author: Sara S.

description: This place is my fav local joint. I get their paneer tikka masala about once or twice a week because I cannot physically tolerate going a full week without this creamy yet spicy curry. Standard meal of curry, rice, and naan is typically about $11 which is a bargain in this city. If you're looking for a curry fix in North Beach / Jackson Square, Raavi is your place.
author: Sean P.

description: This is one of my favorite places in all of SF to eat.  They have the best kind of laid-back atmosphere where I can bring a book and chow down  on the best indian food for my buck.
author: Samuel H.

description: Awesome place, great management and tasty food. The best place to visit with your team for quality Indian food.
author: Ritesh A.

description: If you're ever around this neighborhood (Columbus and Jackson) and you are looking for a really delicious meal, then you gotta check this out.  It's really authentic Indian food for very little money.  Not only that, you get to watch Indian music videos while you eat.  To top it off, the environment is very comfortable too.
author: Buortau L.

description: I thought that this indian restaurant was one of the best indian restaurants that I've been to in San Francisco. As I walked through the doors and then towards the ordering section of the restaurant, I was greeted by the a friendly man at the register. The customer service was exceptionally friendly! The food was satisfying and tasty! Definitely will be coming back again soon!
author: Sharali T.

description: Cheap good food or good cheap food . Will recommend to friends and will be back，so close to north beach  and Chinatown . One if the best Pakistani food I had for a time . Especially the charcoals naan.
author: Tony m.

description: Very delicious food ever. I love their food, very friendly and  clean,  just in one word its awesome I strongly recommend to try their food thanks.
author: Fnu F.

description: My co-worker took me here for lunch. It was one of the best home-style cooked Indian meals I've ever had. Portions were big and very reasonably prices. I will definitely return.
author: Mike P.

description: I got the Paneer Tikka Masala and 1 piece of naan (not included). $8 total. there were 5 pieces of paneer. Are you serious?
author: Greg R.

description:
Very good food Indian/Pakistani food near Chinatown. Was near the Chinatown Hilton and in the mood for Indian. This place popped up. Was hesitant with the ambience, but the food was really delicious! I had the Chicken curry with Garlic naan, a little spicy but good spicy)
Would definitely come back here again!
author: J R.

description: Ended up here after google maps said it was Naan  n Curry (I thought it had moved from o'farrel). Decided to try it and it was amazing! Much better than the old naan n curry (which turns out closed). Food is cooked to order, delicious chicken tikka masala, HUGE and delicious naan and free tea! Can't ask for more! So happy I found this place!
author: Carol B.

description: It's nice that they deliver, and our order arrived in less than half of the estimated delivery time of 60 minutes. Prices were good, and no extra charge for delivery. The biryani, tikka masala, and naan were pretty good. I appreciated that the meat pieces were small enough that after a few bites we weren't left with just rice or sauce. The tikka masala sauce lacked depth and complexity, and was not spicy at all, but paired nicely with the spice in the biryani. The only thing I wouldn't order again is the samosa (came 2 per order). The intense floral note (cardamom I believe?) overpowered any other flavors. And no chutneys came with the order! So sad.
author: Courtney P.

description: This is the best place has really good curry and naan! Use to be naan n curry but they are really friendly and if you need water, grab the pitcher of water from the fridge. CHICKEN MARSALA RICE AND GARLIC NAAN ALL THE WAY!! They've been good to me since day one. If you have spare time then stop by and give it a chance.
author: Jay K.

description: I'm updating my review on Raavi because unfortunately the food's quality has gone down after they took over Naan & Curry. The Vindaloo chicken tastes more like tomato sauce than vindaloo sauce. It is no longer the same and I've decided to look for a new Indian restaurant, but the service is as usual very pleasant.
author: Karla D.

description: This is one of my fav place for lunch over weekdays. Their lamb ghost is amazing and I also like chicken biryani here. Naan needs some improvement here. I would visit here again!
author: Rohit V.

description: Fish with spinach dish was so salty it was inedible without massive amounts of naan.  Flavor was actually quite good, but hard to enjoy with overwhelming saltiness.  The paneer tikka masala was also extremely salty.  Again, good flavor that was ruined with salt.  The cheesy naan was delicious.  Take-out service was solid.  I will try it again and ask for a lot less salt next time.
author: melita s.

description: This review is solely based on their craptastic service. I give big tips for delivery service and I expect the meal to be delivered to my door. If I have to meet you out on the streets, then I might as well hop in the car and do pickup. I will not ever eat at nor order from Raavi.
author: Jen A.

description:
I've come here too many times to remember, and I'll probably be back many times in the future, though there are plusses and minuses.

First, the good:
There are several dishes on the menu which are great! The chicken biryani, achaar, and vindaloo are all delicious. The food is always quick enough, tasty, and the free chai makes dining in a joy (though I usually go after the busy lunch hour).

The caveat:
There are also several dishes on the menu which are clearly designed for tourists that would think a pepperoni is too spicy, and the tikka masala is one of them. I guess ordering that dish here is like ordering lemon chicken at a Chinese place and then wondering why it doesn't taste like a traditional guangzhou dish.

The bad:
I think the decor really needs a lot more work. I kind of wish they kept the murals that were up before. I suppose it's a bit dirty, but its also an old building in SF and isn't above or below anything else similarly priced in the neighborhood.  Maybe to spruce it up, they should showcase some revolving artists like every other cafe in SF.  At least that kind of decoration is free!

Overall I take away one star because I wish more of the menu was a bit more intensely flavored, and the ambiance could do with some improvement. But it is by far the best place to go in the neighborhood to satisfy my cravings for some warm curry to fill my belly!
author: Marcus L.

description: It wasn't bad, but everything was subpar. The tandoori chicken was served with a few uncooked onion slivers, the chicken tikka masala had bland sauce, and there was nothing above and beyond to make up for any of it.
author: Rajesh S.

description: The food is awesome and this is my first time trying curry. It feels very smoothie and delicious. I want to bring some more friends coming with me. BTW the bread is really good.
author: Aether L.

description: By far the best Indian/Pakistani food in San Francisco, very authentic and tasteful. Service is great, prices are much lower compare to other places. Owner is a very friendly and nice guys. They also DELIVER!!
author: Hisham R.

description: I often go there to eat and I have tried almost everything here. Apart from the fact the owner is extremely cool and friendly. The food tastes quite good as compared to anyone around and only restaurant in the locality serving HALLAL food . Their karahi chicken in spicy and chicken tikka masala in mild spicy is really awesome. It's also very reasonable in prices and a good place to try Indian- Pakistani Cuisine. Great deal for students.
author: Yatin A.

description:
Even though the name has changed, the food tastes like it's still a Naan-n-Curry.  As such, it's just okay and no Shalimar or Pakwan.  

They don't have chicken korma but do have chicken tikka masala, which I should've taken as a sign.  I got that, the saag gosht, rice, and garlic naan to go.  It did come out pretty fast, which was a plus in a way, but there may be a reason why Shalimar and Pakwan take longer to make their food.  Cuz in both cases it's noticeably better.
author: Dave N.

description: Really good food. The chicken Karahi is pretty close to exactly what I remembered from eating it in Pakistan. As other reviews mentioned the service is a bit weird (grab your own cutlery and plate) so it only gets 4 stars for that
author: Eric S.

description: Great food, best Indian restaurant ever!!!!!! I love this place! Couldn't get any better than the delicious food at this place! Definitely my little piece of heaven when I get a chance to go! Can't go wrong with anything you order! Great atmosphere and a very nice wait staff are the cherry on top!  Highly recommended. :)
author: Jen B.

description: I will start by saying that I have spent almost two years in India and I have had my fair share of Indian food in the bay area. This place is by far the best. I come here as often as I can. The owner and the rest of the staff are always extremely welcoming and kind, even when I come in 10 minutes before closing. The rice is always perfect and the naan is delicious. I am in love with the vegi tikka masala especially because it's real tikka masala and not korma like other places give you. The spices are always just right and you can really feel the love in the food. I can't say enough good things about this place. $10 gets you a full meal and I never finish it all so I usually have lunch for the next day. Do yourself a favor and try this place.
author: Maya L.

description: This place used to make amazing aloo matar (potato & peas curry), I order that every single time I go, but lately it hasn't been the same. I guess the chef that made it is no longer there.  Very sad.   And the rice isn't the same either, it used to have a little orange color but no more.  Not sure if the other dishes taste the same.
author: Sasa L.

description: My take-out/delivery Indian/Pakistani place ... very decent food. Decent prices. Take out/delivery only though since it is not the cleanest place. Room for improvement there otherwise it is a 5 star joint ...
author: A B.

description: If you are looking for ambiance this is not your place. if you are okay with a hole in the wall restaurant but with very tasty and authentic food that is cheap and fresh, you will not go wrong with this restaurant. The prices are reasonable. The food is freshly made and delicious. The staff are friendly.  No frills but very satisfying Indian food that wont break the bank!
author: Joe B.

description: I love Indian food and there is a dearth of Indian restaurants in downtown SF, so I really wanted to like this place, but the best I can give it is two stars.  The food is decent, but there is one important drawback -- everything is a la carte, there are no combinations.  So if you order chana masala, which I did, you get a large container of chana masala -- you have to order rice, naan, everything else separately.  This makes it very difficult for one person to get lunch.  Even two people would have difficulty ordering a variety of foods in reasonable portions.  The food itself was not bad -- tandoori chicken came with onion and tomato slices and lemon (breaking the a la carte rule) and was good -- spicy, moist and flavorful.  The chana masala (chickpeas in a sauce) came with a lot of sauce and few chickpeas, but I would still rate it pretty good, if not for the a la carte problem.
author: Morgan G.

description: This place is my favorite hidden gem in the city! Perfectly affordable and it's always a feast. I was never really that into Indian food but Raavi has changed me forever. The food is always hot and ready when picked up. I recommend Raavi to everyone looking for an affordable meal in San Francisco.
author: Jordan W.

description: Great indian food at reasonable price. I go twice in a week and enjoy the food. Only Halal meat is served. Vegetable dishes are also tasty. Biryani and Naan are awesome.
author: Jitender D.

description: I feel like in India eating good Indian food when I come to Raavi. Staff is courteous and price is very economical.
author: Umesh T.

description: The food quality was great. Restaurant wasn't clean but I didn't dine in so didn't matter. I liked the biryani and the chicken breast tandoori.
author: Amin K.

description: Raavi is an amazing place with amazing food! The owner is super nice and friendly and the food is pure authentic Desi Indian/Pakistani food. Highly recommended!
author: Vineet S.

description: I had been new to SFO . the moment I entered in sep 2010 , it was a gud place for students who stay close to Jackson and Columbus (Hult) The food is spicy , I bet u can never stop food each time u pass by . The best ones are difficult to choose but try out Naan and chicken tikka masala :) Happy partying at Raavi :)
author: Renuka P.
